Reviews.Title: “Beware if you need to check out early”
Reviews.Author: Dancer46
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in this facility! My sister and I had a five day reservation for Monday thru Friday. On Thursday night we both were sick thru the night due to something we ate Thursday night. We decided to check out the next day and go on home afraid we would not enjoy Friday. When we went to check out the woman at the front desk said we would still have to pay for Friday night since we had not given them 48 hrs. notice. We decided that since we had to pay the $196 we would just stay and lay around there and not allow them to resell the room. But believe me, we will NEVER stay there again. The location was OK, but I would recommend you stay at the Doubletree Suites on 7th at Times Square, an excellent location and wonderful friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: Helena W
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I were in NY for the WMKC Dog Show at MSG's. We were looking for a place within walking distance of the Garden's and to other attractions that was affordable and clean. My Mom had stayed at the Hotel Pennsylvania before and was not impressed (expensive, dirty, noisy). We found it at the Wingate! The staff was amazing! Very friendly and helpful. The Manager, Mr Rommel Gopaz, gave us his card on our first evening there when we went to go sightseeing and told us to call him if we had any problems while we were out. I have never experienced that before! The location was perfect, just a half block from 7th Ave where there was so much to see and do within a few blocks. The street the hotel is on is quiet so you can get a good nights sleep. The rooms were clean and well appointed, there was even a safe in the room which wasn't listed on the web site. The breakfast is excellent with hot and cold choices and the service there amazing as well. The Wingate was exactly what we were looking for during our stay in New York. We will definetly stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of their policies which are new to me!!”
Reviews.Author: Alice H
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - the hotel had a policy that was not expressed at the time of the reservation by Booking.com and which should have been. We wanted to check out one day early due to illness to go home, and the hotel had a policy that not only did you need to give 48 hours notice before arrival if you needed to cancel, but also you had to give 48 hours notice for any day you were not staying. We stayed 5 nights, but could not check out the morning of the 5th day, as we would still be charged for that night anyway. What the [--] kind of policy is that?????? I have never encountered this kind of policy before, and Booking.com should be aware of this and notify potential customers of same. We stayed that 5th night just so they could not re-book it to someone else and get double for the room. We finally found this policy on Windgate's website in EXTREMELY small print!! It was difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: Patricia C
Reviews.Content: After leaving NYC for 8 years, I found myself having to take a business trip for a week. The hotel, lovely. The location, perfect. But the staff, especially Mr. Rommel Gopaz, was superb. Friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. A truly wonderful experience. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: photographersabroad
Reviews.Content: When visiting New York for business, I stayed at this hotel which offered just what I needed at a fair price and good location. Our rooms were basic and clean and located within walking distance to several of the locations I needed to spend time at. They also offered a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Gregking19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and were very happy with everything! Rommel Gopez went out of his way to help us navigate the city, and was always a friendly face at the front desk. We particularly loved the quiet rooms, plush beds and bedding. The location could mot be better, steps from 42nd st madison square garden and the subways. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel Central location”
Reviews.Author: m_hargrove
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 26-12-11 to 31-12-11 central hotel 5 mins walk from times sq n macys free breakfast which is lovely room small but u only sleep here its nyc hotel staff lovely will book trips for u at discount prices. hotel have lots of laptops free to use for guests and free wifi all through the hotel would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: genelle w
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kinda smallish but the rooms are very nice size, the bathroom was great except the shower head was set for taller people... otherwise, everything was great, the internet worked well and was fast and free! The breakfast was compliementary which was very nice. The place is great because you dont need a cab or anything, all the main things that a tourist wuold want to see are all right there!! There was a great little bagel place next door that was delicious and reasonable prices and very good coffee too. We slept great, good beds, nice and quiet for us.. they do have earplugs but we didnt need them. I would be glad to stay here again and I will definatley check out this hotel in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: renato m
Reviews.Content: Kudos !!! I kept on coming back to this Hotel because of the people. The front desk personnel are the best among all the hotels that I have been too. I have been travelling back and forth to NY from Los Angeles, CA and this hotel will always be my first choice. Qualities of this hotel are as follows; 1. Location is in the heart of Manhattan where there are a lot of shopping centers, good food, easy commute and everything is just around the corner. 2. Rooms are very clean, and have a very decent size for King Bed Room and Double Beds. Shower Pressure is great. 3. Complimentary Breakfast is great. 4. Beds are comfortable 5. Wide Variety of Channels on TV 6. WiFi Connection is Great 7. Front Desk, everybody, knows everywhere in manhattan, you will never get lost when you ask there where is it, anything. They know very well all the streets of NY 8. Value for Money, knowing NY. 9. There is a bar/restaurant just on the side of the bldg itself 10. Housekeepers are always nice. They make you feel very "at home". 11. Towels are very fluffy. 12. Great lobby and business center and meeting/conference room. 13. A lot more... Kudos to Mr Rommel Gopez, one of the Managers, he is excellent in accommodating us with all our needs. Everybody was so great and very very very friendly. Mr Paul Martinez and Robert also managers are excellent too. The Front Desk Staff, Ms Sacia who happens to be like our personal front desk (she knows everything what to do for our reservations) plus Juan who is always smiling even its 4 5 6 in the morning after we come back from a bar. We enjoyed talking to him and displays a very nice aura everyday we see him at the front desk. Russel is so accommodating too. He never says no to us, very helpful. So as Winston and Kyla. of course Mr Charles Weed who is the General Manager who is always there and listens to us especially with our concern with the weights in the gym. The whole management of Wingate by Wyndham is superbly excellent. They have a good team there and they know the true meaning of teamwork when it comes to making their guest satisfied and also in making them come back again and again and again. Like us, we stayed here for 22 days just this January alone. This is not including our stay for September to December of last year. We are very glad we found this hotel and we consider this our best hotel that we have ever been staying since we come back and forth to NY for the past 2 years. Congratulations and Keep it up. Special thanks to Mr Rommel Gopez. He is the most understanding Manager that we ever met. He never says no to us. we will be back, hoping to stay there again for the whole month of February if not 100% of the month perhaps 95%. Thanks from the bottom of our heart.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Naomi654
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location to be able to walk to many of the attractions in NYC. Macy's Dept. Store, Macy's Parade, Times Square, 5th Ave., Empire State Bldg., Madison Square Garden, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and Radio City Music Hall. If you don't want to walk or want to go to a further location, the hotel will call a taxi for you which we had them do once and it was very convenient. The hotel was quiet and clean and the included breakfast was good. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great NYC value, free wifi, comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: CrabisGOOD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of December 2010. As many of you know, New York is expensive especially if you want to stay in the city. I read a lot of reviews and even though technically this hotel is ranked 2-2.5 stars on hotel websites, reviews always said 4-5 stars. This hotel is one of the cheaper hotels in the area, but still the price of a 4-5 star hotel in other cities. This place was great! The location was in a cutty alley, but you were in walking distance of Madison Square Garden. There is the train station right underneath it, so you can walk 4 blocks to take the train to the airport depending on which airport you arrived in. There are 2-3 subway stations within 2 blocks of different directions of the hotel. You can also walk to Times Square (8-10 blocks) depending on how lazy you are. Macy's is 2 blocks away so there is still a lot to do where you are located. We enjoyed being here because there were a lot of small eateries that were opened late for you to eat. They were all bad for you, but tasted good. The hotel service was great. They held our bags safely and the breakfast was very good. Make sure you ask what time that it's open until. The waiters were all very nice. There is a computer and free printer to use on the second floor so you can print out your boarding pass. Rooms are clean, bathroom is huge and the beds are like deathtraps. The beds are soft and the covers literally eat you up so you don't want to leave the bed. The only thing is that our heater didn't work properly. It was either off or too hot. Also when we opened our drapes we were looking at the brick building next to us not more than 5 feet away and you could KIND of see into the window of the other person's condo. Awkward. We kept our drapes closed. If I ever come back to NYC, I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1991
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here on our first trip to New york. The hotel is right near Macys and only a short walk to Times Square. For a new York hotel, the rooms were large. we slept very well in the comfy beds. There is early morning noises from the bin men, but not as bad as it would be if you stayed on times square, as the hotel is down a side street. Overall we found our stay to be very pleasant. the rooms were clean and nicely made, we also had a fridge, and tea and coffee making facilities, which is really hardy after being on your feet all day.. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good relation beween qualty and price”
Reviews.Author: TenerifeMach1
Reviews.Content: Its our second time in this hotel my family and other friends expend a week in Wingate, from 2 to 9th december.. I can only say that is a very nice place to stay in Midtown .The rooms are very confortable, there are two magnific beds, the bathroom is big enough. The breakfast is also very good.The staff of the hotel is realy kind. The guy at breakfast lunch (i think his name is Fernando) is allways smiling and helping you if necesary.The staff at the front desk mainly in the evening ( Mr Russell makes you feel like at home) is very polite they say hallo every time and makes you feel comfortable during all stay.Even the technician( that we need once for an air cond, problem) is too a very friendly guy, Daniel i think was his name.I suggest to say to the two ladys at the front desk in the morning that smile a little bit to the guests is a good idea as they are the only unlikely point of the hotel review. Anyway I hope to be back on 2012.

Reviews.Title: “ok place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: cgignac
Reviews.Content: They overbook frequently & they messed up our room charges......we booked with one card which we wanted to use as the payment, gave a different card for incidentals which we were told would not be charged & yep they charged the wrong card. Quite a mess to get everything figured out. Rooms are clean & bed comfortable....noise machines & ear plugs in all rooms which helps with the sleep (especially on ground level floors). Breakfast is good & served for a good length of time. Front desk associates at night are so-so.....seemed too busy for one person between answering room calls, check-in & providing guest services. Would stay here again if only for 1 or 2 nights & last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Ginnette12 Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a night's stay at this hotel. It was so clean and spotless, and the towels were white and fluffy. The beds were very comfortable. They provide a hairdryer and Neutrogena lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. The room had a nice computer desk and free wifi. If you don't have a computer along, they give you a password to use their computers free of charge. We had a refrigerator and a microwave. The location is perfect. It is close to the Harald Square subway station and to Macy's. The breakfast buffet is outstanding with scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, bagels, cereal, and fruit. The staff is wonderful! Every staff member I encountered was polite, friendly, and took the time to offer help or to make small talk with us. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Clean/ Tasty Hot Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Alex7797
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The entire hotel was spotless!! Great location- behind Macy's, walking distance to Times Square and close to subway. The beds were very cozy and comfortable. We appreciated the hot breakfast every morning - waffles, eggs, sausage, bacon, coffee, hot chocolate etc.... I was surprised they served decaf coffee - I usually have a hard time finding it. The two guys in charge of the breakfast area were very polite/helpful..actually all the employees we encountered at the hotel were friendly, lots of smiling faces I would definitely stay again and highly recommend this hotel fyi, our room had a microwave and refrigerator - we were able to keep water and snacks for the kids

Reviews.Title: “Location is near perfect”
Reviews.Author: BCandBeyond
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a great hotel. The location is awesome, with the 34st subway line about 7 minutes walk away from the front door, from there you can get anywhere. Tip: if you're there for a few days, get an unlimited rides MTA card, as it will save you big time time. The included breakfast was ok, though it's difficult to make do with cereal, toast etc when you have so many options to cafes to visit ;-) Our room was nice, the wifi was great and the maid service was very efficient. There was a lot of street noise at night, but this is NYC. A room at the back of the hotel might be quiter. I would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Wingate Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: K Q
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, Hotels.com messed up my reservation by not leaving a valid credit card to charge and Romel the nicest, customer focus agent made sure every thing was taken care and we got into our room ASAP. Thanks Romel!! Location: Location is excellent. It is basically across from Macy's, around the corner from Penn Station/subway, Madison Square garden and a few (walkable) blocks from Times Square. Room: Room was great! Good size for NY. Room was very clean. Has a microwave and fridge. Wifi: Wifi is free and worked without any issues Breakfast: Hey-It's free! Take anything free in NY. Bagels, waffles, eggs, bacon, and pastries. Front desk staff: Very friendly and helpful. They were able to assist with accurate subway information I will be back Again!!! Thanks Wingate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Olli_13
Reviews.Content: Positive surprise after all the stories wa have heard about NY hotels. Friendly and helpful staff. Big and clean room with good bed. OK breakfast included. Nice little restaurant just next to this hotel (door from reception, breakfast is offered here) with good happy hour and friendly staff. Location is good, walking distance to many places and subway is near. I think price is quite good what comes to NY standards. Noise during night from 35th street (garbage trucks, etc) is only minus. On the other hand we got ear plugs for next night without any request... :-) Could easily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price!”
Reviews.Author: Summer D
Reviews.Content: I have to book on the cheap for work, and I've stayed at other business hotels in the area that were old, dingy, tiny rooms and just not great. I assumed they were all like that for the price and location, but found the Wingate for same price and was really impressed. The was very clean, rooms were large and much more modern, and location was really convenient (especially being 1 block off Fashion Ave as I had left my coat at home and needed to grab something quickly!). Will definitely stay here again for business trips and recommended to my coworkers. It was also surprisingly quiet and slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Gazoo68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few timew. Always quiet, ez chk in and out. Showers work well. Elevator is a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison N
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into the lobby after my delayed flight - I was treated very well. I would higly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in NYC in Manhattan - delightful staff and ready to make sure you have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel tucked away in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: HotelXpert2011
Reviews.Content: Great gem in the middle of the city. Short walking distance to penn station and Macy's! Service was great, front desk even helped to assist us find the type of bar to go out to! Rooms small (as are they all in the city) ABD clean! Front desk granted us late check out.... Only complains we're parking- lot was $45 overnight and a far walk! Also, thankful they gave us late check out but I have never actually had an employee stand at my hotel door and wait for me to leave the room after late check out. If your a person that is always on time and do not have a car in the city, I would deffinately reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with central location and reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: crimmo
Reviews.Content: If you are flying into NYC via JFK this is a great option because it is 1 minute from Penn Station, where the trains from JFK arrive. It is centrally located, close to Macy's, Empire State Building etc. The rooms are very clean and there is free wi fi, there is also a complimentary breakfast. All of this for a good price, can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Pedro P
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay for a business conference. Front desk staff was very nice as well as the gentleman serving breakfast the next morning. My room was another story. I stayed in room #205. Very close to the air conditioning systems towards the back of the hotel and facing another building. Not very private and extremely noisy. I could not sleep all night. TV was very small and practically my laptop computer screen was much easier to view. The coffee maker did not make and as a coffee drinker, this was a must. The bathroom was very nice and comfortable. There were complimentary ear buds on the night stand, so that should have told me something about the noise in the room. I love the Wingate and stay with them often in other cities, but I was not happy about this particular hotel in NYC. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: GFGManchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with in September 2011. The rooms are spacious although I felt it smelt rather musty. It is in a good location close to penn station. The breakfast was ok, the waffle machines were popular & the coffee good but generally most guests in the breakfast room commented on the poor choice available particularly with limited fruit, cooked meats & cheese. The breakfast room had very loud air con but a nice choice of outside or inside eating areas. The staff were helfpful & friendly throughout the hotel. I agree with another reviewed that the charge for leaving luggage for a few hours at the end of the stay was expensive. Overall I think with the endless choice of hotels in NYC I will not be returning to this one in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Between the disappointment at check in and at check out we had a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: noodlesandsam
Reviews.Content: Our overall impression about our stay at the Wingate will be it was a nice stay and experience. However, I will check rates and reviews at other hotels before staying there again. We were visiting New York on a quick anniversary get away. I had let the hotel know in advance so I was disappointed when nothing had been done as requested. Yes, it is a small thing but it's the small things that separate a good stay from a great one. Our stay while we were there was good. I thought the rooms were a decent size especially being in New York, with so much to do you are only in the rooms to sleep. The rooms were clean which is always my biggest concern. The last day there was disappointing. The day of check out they were more concerned about the new guests then they were us. They were very short short and really weren't interested in helping us.

Reviews.Title: “Big beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AussieChick1
Reviews.Content: Big, spacious rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Free breakfast. Good location but no views. In a quieter street compared to some.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: While looking for a hotel on line, the Wingate Midtown appeared to be a nice hotel so we booked it by phone and looked forward to our upcoming stay. We had just arrived from a week in D.C. having stayed at a lovely hotel downtown for $80 less per night. Â When we arrived, the Wingate lobby was small with very little seating. Â  When we stepped out of the elevator on the 8th floor we were shocked and disgusted by the incredibly filthy carpet. Our room although small, seemed sufficient, however during our stay it became less and less inviting to come back for our evening stay. The sheets on the bed did not fit the mattress. Â Every night at least once or twice, we would awaken to the sheet being off the corners of the mattress and wrapped around our legs. Â The sheets were NEVER changed in the 4 days we were there and we did not leave out a Do Not Disturb sign or any other notice to not remake our room. Â  Each day the bed was remade, but the sheets not fitting was very uncomfortable and unacceptable. The one chair to relax in was worn and uncomfortable. Â The desk chair did not fit under the desk and was awkward to maneuver, taking up space in the room. The bathroom floor was never cleaned because what was there after our first day, remained Â throughout the stay. The never ending fan in the bathroom drove us crazy without the option to turn it off. A magnifying mirror would have been a welcome addition. Only 2 paper cups were left in the room and not even left in a upright position or stacked. The entire weight machine in the exercise room was broken during our stay and unusable. Â The remote control for the TV also disappeared after Monday. The garbage trucks kept us awake along with the tangled sheets night after night. Although the trucks are no fault of the hotel's, we think it should be disclosed to all guests prior to check in.Â  The last day of our stay, it was raining heavily and in order to get a cab, we were told we needed to go out to 7th, almost a block away, to hail our cab. Â That seemed odd that the hotel wouldn't call for one. The personnel was friendly and capable, the breakfast very good, and we appreciate access to the business machines, wi-fi and telephone at no charge. Â The location was good and close to public transportation. Â These were not the issues. Â But for the above stated conditions we would not stay at the hotel again nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant boutique hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: djsilversmith
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the garnment district and very close to most "On Broadway" theaters, this hotel is a superb location off the main avenues. Rooms are rather large for NYC, and the morning complementatry breakfast offers a nice variety. This hotel is priced competitvely with 4-star Manhattan establishments, which means it is relatively expensive from someone from Preoria. Staff is reasonably helpful. My only peeve is that the bellmen charges $5.00/bagf for short term storage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: julesr101
Reviews.Content: Very close to herald square, Macy's and several subway stations so very convenient. Also very close to Penn station which is where the train goes to/from Newark airport so if flying into/from there it's very handy. Trains from Newark airport only 25 minutes to Penn station then 5 mins walk to hotel. Breakfast included which was enough to keep u going til lunchtime, it's continental but there is some eggs and bacon buffet, waffles, bagels, cereal. Free wi fi also which is handy. Rooms reasonable size considering itsmidtown manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alice C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited New York in January to attend a Prince concert at Madison Square Garden. This hotel suited our needs perfectly. It was reasonably priced, only a block from MSG, and had easy access to every place in NYC we wanted to visit. We could walk to Times Square, and several subway stations were closeby. Taxis were also cheap, and the front desk was always happy to arrange for a cab to be waiting for us by the front door when we came downstairs. Our room was very comfortable and nicely appointed, with a king bed, comfortable bedding, and modern bathroom. The hot breakfast was impressively varied and supplied us plenty of energy every morning to play around town. We would definitely stay here again, especially if we are attending another concert at MSG. This hotel is a fantastic value, considering the price, location, and quality of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice !”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 18 ladies who visited this hotel for 4 nights. All were very pleased with this choice ,made with the assitance of groupplanner.com. The location was great. The price within our budget,The rooms were a nice size for Manhattan and were very clean. the staff were excellent. They offer a free breakfast which a great way to start before hitting the streets of Manhattan.The beds were comfortable .It was very quiet .The view from the room was not the best but who goes to New York to look out a window! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: meatybite
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super easy to find and very convenient to both Penn Central station and 35th & Penn subway. The hotel is downtown so be prepared for the people, noise and dirty streets. The hotel is a nice oasis amid the chaos. You will not get a view from your room, but that's what Top of the Rock is for! The rooms are a decent size and the bathroom was large by NYC standards. Our room was quiet with no noise....except for the air conditioner which whines like a truck engine. I had to use the ear plugs each night to sleep with the A/C on. I thought the free hotel breakfast was a nice touch. OK, it is not fancy. But with scrambled egg, bacon, cereals, toast, pastries, juices & coffee it was a good start to the day. And I loved the waffle machine with little cups of pre-made batter that you just pour onto the waffle iron. It was a little tricky (make sure you spray with oil first) but good fun. The front desk staff were very friendly whenever we dealt with them. The do charge $5 a bag for storage but I think that is not uncommon or unreasonable. Beware of using the hotel to organise transport to JFK. I asked them to book a cab and was told it would be $75! They will book you into a private â€œtown carâ€� service which is overpriced. Either get a cab off the street for $50 or take the subway & airtrain which cost us about $5 a person. Overall the hotel was just fine for a few days and it's proximity to the subway makes it a good place to be based from.

Reviews.Title: “This Conceirge is Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Paulfocus2010
Reviews.Content: Been to the Wingate a few times but this was the first time I used the Conceirge. His name was Rommel. You can tell that he genuinely wants the guests to be comfortable and that this is more than just a job for him. I usually have my restaurant selections made but asked him for a recommendation. He sent us to B. Smith's. I've walked by that restaurant several times but had never been there. The dinner was exceptional! Had I not asked for his advice we wouldn't have had such a great evening. This is a great hotel; take advantage of the services. It will make your stay in NYC that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Hotel, a pearl downtown NY”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMarc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in september 2011. We just run into it after we had a rather bad experience at the hotel Pennsylvania. The staff was really very nice & friendly and offered us full support. We actually could bring our luggage next day at 9pm in order to do our NY seeings, as check-in time was first at 15pm, quiet some service!! The room, a double King, was clean, friendly arranged, and did not leave any Q open. There was more then enough space for 4 pieces of luggage, still leaving enough space to feel at home. The hotel has a bar, witch we attended one night, and i must say we really enjoyed the atmosphere! It is just "a walk around the corner" to end up in the NY downtown life, and still the Hotel breathes silence as the street is not one of those traffic jam sound gardens as you often face them downtown. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others. By booking thru phone with Wyndham, we got a really good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rizzy65
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Wingate started off with news that the hotel had only king beds left, that was a problem since we were two teens and two moms. The front desk staff called manager, Rommel in. Rommel was extremely apoligetic and showed us the room available. The room was large enough for two twin air mattresses which were promptly delivered.The girls were happy with the situation so we went with it. Rommel made us very comfortable and could not have been nicer! He was willing to do whatever it took to make us happy. Even treated us to dinner! The hotel was clean and convienient to all of what we were looking for in NYC. Subway stops were right around the corner and Times Square was an easy walk. I would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Location, Good Price, Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EzzTyr
Reviews.Content: Located just two short streets from Penn Station and less than ten from Times Square, the location couldn't be better. The room is large for the price in New York and very high quality, particularly the bathroom (most important for me). The breakfast is generous for a 'continental plus', having a nice hotfood complement to the continental spread. Staff were very friendly and their Wi-Fi internet access reliable and fast. Only negatives were a surprisingly noisy air-conditioner, though its consistency meant you got used to it, and limited mobile (cell) phone reception in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMonkey0
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my other half recently - we chose it based on positive reviews, the location and the good price (good for New York that is!). The room was larger than expected (my OH has stayed in New York on several occasions and was suitably impressed). Our room was marked as wheelchair accessible, so perhaps it was slightly bigger than usual. The location was ideal for our plans of sightseeing and some shopping - you couldn't ask for a better spot unless you had a specific part of the city you wanted to stay in. It's handy for the Empire State Building, Times Square etc. and there's a subway station right at the end of the street. We didn't have too many dealings with the staff, but whenever we did (such as organising a late checkout) they were friendly and efficient. I would have two minor gripes, which others have already mentioned: 1. The air conditioning is quite loud. While this wasn't a major problem for us, I would imagine that in summer or for light sleepers, it might be an issue. 2. The five dollar charge for holding a bag. Granted it's a minimal charge, but it rankles to pay for something every other hotel I've ever been to has done for free. Quibbles aside. this is a nice hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jan154964
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from a wonderful vacation in NYC. I chose the Wingate based on reviews I had read on Trip Advisor/Expedia. Location is ideal. Minutes from Madison Square Gardens, Penn Station, Macy's, Herald Square, Times Square, Theatre District...all within walking distance (wear comfy shoes) Hotel itself was good, included breakfast (the usual continental type) and free internet. Rooms are on the small side but that is average size for New York. Not much daylight through the windows as it is built between buildings. On the downside, the air conditioner in our room was extremely noisy. Every time it cut in it would wake me up. Also, bring your own washcloths. Upon arrival to our hotel we did not have any washcloths. Called down to the desk and did get a couple. However, the next day after housekeeping had been in, again no washcloths. Called twice to get some only to be told afterwards that there were none available!!! We were two days with no washcloths. Also, this hotel has an outdoor area for breakfasat dining - quite nice but they need to do something about keeping the pidgeons away...if you left your plate for a second, the pidgeons would come perch at your table. All in all I would recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay here again...I would just bring my own washcloths next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: JackWonderful
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my partner in August, while in New York as tourists. We've been to New York a number of times before and so we know the area. We went for this hotel because of the great location and (booking at short notice) the great price offered. The hotel is excellently located a few minutes walk from Penn Station and from subway connections. There are plenty of restaurants, convenience stores, pharmacies and the like in the surrounding streets. It is perhaps ten minutes from the Empire State Building at a reasonable walking pace. The street itself is quiet, compared to the surrounding streets, which is good for street noise issues. The lobby is small but fine, and the room we had was a good size for New York, easily sufficient for the two of us and our bags. It was clean, and overlooked the street below, and so quiet. Bathroom was fine and clean (shower over bath rather than shower cubicle). Air conditioning worked well, albeit was a bit noisy. Our rate came with complimetnary buffet breakfast which was available from 6am. Quality was good and food on offer included cooked and contintental items, breads and rolls, tea, coffee and fruit juice. There was also the facility to make your own waffles. There was a small patio area at the side of the hotel (between it and the next building) if one wanted to sit outside to eat breakfast. Staff were universally helpful and friendly, recommending good nearby restaurants when asked. If I was visiting New York again, and if I am looking for a good hotel in the Midtown area I would have no hesitation in considering this hotel again, if the price was right. For New York and the price offered, we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Ashley N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in July. The service was great, rooms were spectacular, and location was great! I will definitely be back here again! I recommend this hotel to anyone who will be staying in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Manager needs a refresher in customer relations skills”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel286
Reviews.Content: Myself, my mother and sister just returned from visiting NYC, our first few nights were spent at the Renaissance in Times Square and for the remaining 3 nights of our stay we booked the Wingate, using my Wyndham rewards points ( booked several months in advance) Trying to find comfortable and roomy accomadations for three adults during labour day weekend proved tricky, but I thought I really did my research and that everything was planned accordingly. The agent I spoke to for Wyndham rewards, suggested I book a loft style room which according to her and their website , is basically the same as a double queen size room with the exception of much larger windows, floor to ceiling and a loft style roof, much higher then your standard 8 ft ceilings, so everything has a much more spacious feeling. It sounded perfect. That is until we arrived at the hotel, after lunch, check in wasn't until 3pm , so desk attendant offered to put our luggage in storage as we had tickets to a matinee show, we didn't arrive back at the hotel until 8pm, to retreive our keys. Once we arrived in our room (1801) , we realized right away we were given the wrong room. The room was extremley crammed, even by NY standard, one very small window,with no view, other then a brick wall, the furniture and fixtures, were old and dated, and carpeting was stained. I was uncertain at this point if they just gave us a crappy room bc we used points, as it looked nothing like the pics on the website ( regardless, thousands of dollars were spent at their hotels to accumulate those points) I phoned right away and spoke to a desk clerk, who informed me no other room was available , and asked me to wait a minute until he put his manager on the line, I expected him to say that since we arrived so late they gave our loft style room away and he would have us in our correct room in the morning, instead he began to tell me that we were in fact in a loft style room, I assured him that there must be some mistake as we only had a standard height room, it was very small, and was missing the floor to ceiling windows. he said the ceiling is in fact a couple inches higher then standard room, and when I questioned the window, he said actually Mrs, we don't even offer a loft style room, so whoever you spoke to in reservations gave you incorrect information, and he said he'd speak to them to be sure it doesn't happen again. I replied that my confirmation information that was sent to me thru email clearly states loft style room, floor to ceiling windows, with more room then a standard room. he said again it doesn't exist and he'd rectify it with reservations ( I knew that this point he was being dishonest and he gave our room away and had no intention of fixing the problem) so I said, you should also have a talk to whoever designed your webpage, because that exact information that the reservation agent gave me is listed there as well. He replied with " Well I'm not sure what you want me to do about this , other then me coming up with a sledgehammer and start beating out walls and ceilings" I knew at this point I was beating a dead horse, so I just said, you and I both know that certainly isn't an option, I was just looking to receive what I paid for, nothing more , nothing less. As a business owner myself I couldn't imagine speaking to my clients this way, makes me wonder if customer service even exists anymore? Certainly left a bad taste in my mouth, and I'll be sure to tell family, friends, co-workers and my many clients travelling to NYC to avoid this hotel. Other then the bad management, the location is sketchy, beds are hard , had to request extra pillows, the two pillows on each bed are flat as pancakes, out of the 3 of us, none of us could get good cell coverage anywhere in our room, internet was also tricky, the only positive thing I could say was the complimentary breakfast was actually not bad as far as free hotel breakfasts went, but I think I would much prefer to stay at a nicer hotel , in a better neighbourhood with better customer service and pay for my breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: Great experience the staff was very friendly, the room and bathroom was spacious and clean, quiet room and nicely decorated, 1/2 block away from 7th. Avenue. I highly recommend this Hotel. it also has FREE Wi-Fi and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Psobie
Reviews.Content: My first contact was with Paul, a very friendly and accommodating person. All of the other staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The rooms were roomy, the hotel clean, and there were plenty of breakfast items to choose from. The location was convenient. There is no onsite parking but a garage, well staffed, is in the next block. We were able to drop our luggage off in front of the hotel, something I was concerned about before arriving. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: The room was clean - beds are small only doubles. Air conditioner very loud but it worked to keep room comfortable and ventilated. The bathroom was clean and fully stocked. Remote did not work for TV, but we are perfectly capable of getting up and walking to TV, and some channels did not have volume. The staff at front desk that I encountered was WONDERFUL... the staff in the free breakfast area, except for Sunday ,was not very polite and when you asked for items that should have been out they were rude and seemed to try to avoid getting it for you, they actually would walk away remove dishes from a table (which they never wiped off any table just removed used dishes) and sometimes I had to actually ask several times. I am sure many people waste food as I saw happening, but this ruined this experience for the rest of us who just really wanted a yogurt... I would stay here again as the location was good for uptown and downtown ventures.

Reviews.Title: “Good depending on what's important to you”
Reviews.Author: UrviB
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Big rooms, well furnished, clean, nice bathroom, nice toiletries - Free internet and local calls - Good location Cons: - food, free breakfast is edible but very average - service, staff can be hit and miss, some are friendly and helpful, others were short and quite rude - hotel outside your room itself is sub par. I was quite disappointed when i walked into the hotel but changed my mind after seeing the room. Still they could improve the decor of the lobby, dining area, gym, etc. Most important thing for me was a nice room, which i had, so i was reasonably happy. i wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here but i'll definitley try other options next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the hotel a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: MAdiner
Reviews.Content: Kudos to Michael at the front desk and the rest of the crew at the Wingate. As other reviews have said, it's a good, basic hotel. The breakfast are is actually lovely, the beds are comfortable and the location is great. But it's the staff that will bring me back. They're friendly, helpful, efficient and just plain nice. I was there for a weekend with two teenage girls and they were just as impressed!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: calif_10
Reviews.Content: We decided on staying at the Wingate based on Tripadvisor recommendations after agonizing over trying to find a hotel within walking distance to TImes Square as well as other sites, free internet, and a decent breakfast included in the room rate. I was apprehensive at first glance because it is fairly small (6 rooms/floor) but checkin was easy and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast staff was so helpful- there was a nice selection of items and a nice area for eating. It took less than 10 minutes to walk to Times Square and Macy's is just a minute away. We really walked everywhere from the Wingate! I agree with other reviewers that the air-conditioning unit in the room is a little loud but the hotel overall is quiet because it is just off the Time Square area. This is a good value for traveling with a family. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We would be back, sure”
Reviews.Author: zsofi_50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of NY, just a half block from Macys. NY subway is available on every corner, the crossover buses go on 34th Street, the Penn Station is 3-4 minutes away (that's why we chose this hotel, we went to several towns with train). The free high speed internet access was very comfortable - you must ask for a password at the reception. The complimentary hot buffet breakfast gave us a good start - and you can cook your own waffle!!!! The choice was not very good, but in most hotels they don't give you a free breakfast..The fridge and the microwave are a great plus in the room. And also the safe. The staff was friendly and helpful, we could get a quiet room on higher floor, not facing the street. When possible, I would recommend you to ask for a such one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Wingate last Fall. It was my first time visiting NYC, so location was key. This hotel was near Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, Garment district, and more! It was great to be able to walk there, instead of having to get a cab. The rooms are modern and clean. I enjoyed the free breakfast buffet every morning. No complaints on anything!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, needs better attention to details”
Reviews.Author: bradshsi
Reviews.Content: The good: The location is excellent, close to Times Square, Penn Station and other touristy things. It is a new build, so no crummy shared bathrooms or scrungy dated rooms that some NY hoteliers seem to think passes for acceptable in 2011. Free internet and free breakfast. Yay for free stuff. Rooms are a decent size, clean and comfortable. There is a fridge for storing your food. The less good: The room AC is loud and boomy (as is the vent fan in the bathroom). Personally I'd recommend Wyndham sue the company who installed the HVAC. The internet was a little flakey. Every so often it decided I wasn't a paying guest and wanted me to give it money. Speed was not super high. The in room coffee machine is one of those single pod type machines. They are a nice idea but the machines are badly designed and tend to leak coffee or split the pods so that they spill used coffee grounds everywhere when you remove them. The soda machine is buried in the basement, which is ok since space is limited, but they don't make it clear in their hotel guide. Overall I liked the hotel and would happily stay there again. It was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Clean, Great Price, Great complimentary Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: karabear0414
Reviews.Content: Great basic hotel. It was a last minute booking for something clean but reasonably priced. It was in a great location, with subways SO close which made it very easy to get anywhere in the city we wanted! The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. In the morning they offered a complimentary breakfast which was great! It was bagels, muffins, eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, tea, coffee, juices, fruit, etc! It was a great thing to have in the morning! ''I would definitely return here with out question!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Minhtrung1811
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel with close distance to everything. The room is very spacious for manhattan and very clean. Staffs are very friendly and free breakfast is a plus. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “it was OK but...”
Reviews.Author: happymeyifei
Reviews.Content: - the air conditioning was way too loud. it was really hard to sleep with all that noise. we stayed for 3 days and we didn't sleep well. The location was excellent and there were no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home from home!”
Reviews.Author: betshepherd
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we felt at home. The welcome was very friendly, and we were assisted well. We found everything at the hotel to our satisfaction. The room was superb and had all the necessary features. The breakfast was excellent and gave us a wonderful start to the day. The location of the hotel was ideal with easy access to the subway and all the attractions. We were very happy to stay here for two weeks and would not hesitate to return to this comfortable hotel. We shall definately recommend the Wingate. Pete & Betty Shepherd. Durban. South Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Sol_Juan_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I was there with my mom for 12 days. The hotel is great, well located, very clean rooms. Breackfast is not wow but itÂ´s ok to start your morning! Coffe, fruits, cereals, bread and waffles. The only problem we had is that we booked a top floor room because of the view, but the noise of the air conditioner machines in the roof was terrible! So the personal, really kind, showed us other rooms in other floors so we can choose the one with no noise. They treated us really good! Great location, close to Broadway, Empire State, everything! I will be back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “My knees did not touch the wall”
Reviews.Author: TROD6
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker. I am very use to staying in hotels where the bathrooms are so small you can sit on the toilet and bruise your knees on the wall. Not this hotel. This hotel was perfect... The staff was so attentive and knowlegeable. I must say I really appreciated the african american young lady at the front desk's knowledge of the best eating and shopping areas in NYC. I could tell that she was giving very passionate reviews based on her experience and love for what she does. (I'm sorry I did not get her name) The rooms are perfectly sized, the beds are very comfortable and the full breakfast is amazing. I must say after I read a few reviews on here I thought twice about visiting the wingate, but it would have been stupid for me to make any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Fab587
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while helping our daughter get settled for a summer internship in the city. It is in an excellent location and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, subways, etc. The room was a decent size, was very clean, and the staff very courteous and helpful! Any request we had was met promplty and cheerfully. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, friendly staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cilene303631
Reviews.Content: Four Brazilian ladies in NYC looking for a clean, comfortable hotel and this was what we found at Wingate. The only thing we were not happy with was the size of the doublebeds. They were too small for two people. The air-conditioner was a little noisy but there was no other noise as our room was at the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe how good it was!”
Reviews.Author: deamallin
Reviews.Content: I used my Wyndham Rewards, but I couln't believe how terrific this small hotel turned out to be! From the moment I arrived, everyone from the desk clerk to the manager saw to it that I was treated as I would be at a five-star hotel. My luggage was stored immediately (and I later was able to retrieve it super-fast), I was offered breakfast - which calls itself "continental" but has everything for the bagels-and-cream-cheese folks, the eggs and bacon folks, and the vegans. Wow! Just wow! My room had a huge bathroom with all amenities(even a lovely Neutrogenia French-milled facial soap unavailable to the general public), and while it was beautifully central (on 35th between 7th and 8th), there were layers of sheer and black out possibilities for the windows and a recording of gentle ocean (?) sounds gave me the best of being central and being sheltered from invasive NYC. My bed? A-plus for comfort, pillows, linens and down comforter. And while I'm a good camper, I know my 5-star bedding. When I came down for breakfast at 6:30 am -- I had an early conference -- the woman vacuuming in the lobby stopped her vacuuming so I wouldn't hear the noise, and she nodded sweetly and said, "Good Morning!" to me. The manager, Paul Martinez, has such genteel manners and looks after everyone's needs to the nth degree. I think the people working there are the complement to his own sense of service, elegance, and warmth. Lots of Europeans were staying here. In the 90's, before the internet, I wrote regularly about travel and reviewed many a 5-star hotel from Rome to Venice and from Paris to Palm Beach. This hotel, under Paul Martinez, has the elan and eclat of a five-star in its little boutique heart.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Waldolover05
Reviews.Content: Never been to NYC before and was looking for the perfect balance of clean/spaciousness/location/value and the Wingate by Wyndham provided this. Check-in was no problem and room (on the top floor) had just as much space as a hotel room in a not-so-crowded city and was clean and well equipped. Three of us shared a two-double bed room and had plenty of space for our luggage and towels. Mini fridge was a great bonus and bathroom had plenty of room and hot water. No sign of bed bugs (a big concern for me) and decent hot breakfast (waffles, toast, eggs, sausage, cereal, apples) in the morning. If/when I make it back to NYC in the near future I will likely re-book here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Spacious Rooms and Great Breakfast - will be back!”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The room rate was not ovelry expensive for Midtown Manhattan and located the perfect distance from Penn Station and all the Midtown stores and restaurants. had the free breakfast in the morning and was very happy with the food - especially for free! The room was very spacious for NYC and had a mini fridge and microwave which worked out great for a late night snack. There are only 6 rooms on each floor so you are always close to an elevator/stairway. The bathrooms were very clean and the bedding was extremely comfortable. Our room was facing the courtyard/breakfast area (not the street) so it was very quiet and we slept well. I would definitely reccommend and return again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of noise!”
Reviews.Author: Susan5t
Reviews.Content: Constant garbage truck noise from 11p.m. to at least 5a.m. Also an air conditioner loud hum in our room & we didn;t have the air condition on in our room. The staff was very pleasant & friendly. A nice buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: libbydusvi
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful, clean and quiet for NYC. It even came with one of those sound machines with about 8 choices of sound - I chose ocean waves. Maybe that is why I thought it was quiet. A/C worked great too. Definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: neillennon
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel in january of this yr i would hÃ¬ghly recommend it the staff were fantastic in particular massi the concierge n bar staff i will be visiting new york again and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecfc2000
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was much better than what i thought it would be. Rooms were big, clean and modern. Staff were also friendly. If i had a problem they'd sort it immediatly. we wee on the 7th floor facing the street and noise levels were at a minimum. The breakfast is my only negative comment. The variety wasnt great, there was no instructions to use the waffle machine and if you got there a little late there wasnt much left. Still, it's better than what most hotels offer in the area so cannot complain too much. Also, I wasn't impressed with the $5 dollar a bag charge for holding them after check out, seen as though we were there 7 nights. All in all, an excellent weeks stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pilot review... Amazing Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Piloyguy28
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I have stayed here multiple times! Wonderful staff.. Spotless rooms.. Great amenity kits.. Clean lobby.. And great location! Can't say anything better! I will use this hotel for all of my personal trips.. Makes work seem like heaven! Especially the beds!!! Talk about sleeping on cloud nine!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Musashi78
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 weeka at thia hotel, in 2 different rooms. The 1st, at the 7th floor was great. The other 2nd floor wasn't that good. Wireless internet was compimentary, but the signal was terrible in my room at the 2nd floor. The breakfast is good, but since it is exactly the same everyday, on the 3rd day you'll be looking for other alternatives. Rooms are very clean and the beds very comfy! Totally recommend for whom prefer the agitation of midtown.

Reviews.Title: “great place conveinent location”
Reviews.Author: bruziks
Reviews.Content: very clean ,beds were sooo comfortable,very quiet no annoying taxi horns.Breakfast included in the morning was a nice feature make your own waffles.One block to macys and madison square garden

Reviews.Title: “This in now my favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HNLGAL
Reviews.Content: Booked in this hotel because of location, price and reviews read here. I cannot give high enough praise for it. I arrived the day the Blizzard of New York (2010) hit. Fortunately I only had to go out once as the streets were a mess. However the hotel was like an oasis. The room was modern, spacious and sparkling clean, the bath modern, spacious, featured a marble vanity and clean as a whistle, the bed very comfortable, a large very comfortable lounge chair (with a hassock for your legs) that made for comfortable TV viewing and relaxing. The room also had a safe large enough for a laptop. Most importantly for me, it also had a big desk and office chair for me to work at. The room also had large windows that looked out to the front of the hotel where I could see the snow piling up. I holed up here to catch up on some work (free wifi) for a couple of days and to try to connect with a friend who was trying to get to New York but whose flight was cancelled due to the blizzard (FREE LONG DISTANCE!!!). The hotel also offered a complimentary breakfast but I didn't try it, I didn't have to go out to eat as there was an excellent diner around the corner who actually delivered - even during the worst weather - so I ordered a couple of meals at a time as the hotel had a fridge and microwave as well. The staff at the front desk were superb during what was truly a very trying experience for many. I had reserved one of those express shuttles to take me to the airport and whom I called the day before to confirm but they called me early on the morning of departure to say, sorry... their vans couldn't make it and I had to find something else. I resigned myself to a very expensive taxi to the airport and when I checked out, I asked the dark-haired girl if she could recommend anyone in particular. She said why don't you use our car? Apparently taxis can end up costing a lot more than a hotel car what with traffic and wait times so I opted to go with their service instead which was a flat rate and guaranteed no matter how long it took. I was told I had to wait a bit as the car was booked for a pile of people waiting in the lobby so I went next door to the diner for a bagel and some coffee. I was very surprised when the front desk agent (wish I could remember her name!) came to find me at the diner because she had secured a SUV 4 wheel drive to take me and it was ready now. She had slogged through the snow to find me which was way above and beyond service. Plus, she then had the driver find a break in the snow so I get to him! Exceptional hotel and exceptional service = especially under such difficult circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good deal at very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CooperAlex
Reviews.Content: Typically, we stay Embassy Suites or equivalent hotels I stayed at the Wingate for 4 nights with my wife and three kids (ages 8, 6 and 2). We got two double beds for $150/night, which included breakfast. We were concerned it would be a dump b/c that seemed like a price (in NYC) to be "too good to be true", but it was great. The room was large (by NYC standards), we had my 8 yr old sleep in a sleeping bag on the floor (with plenty of room). The breakfast was fantastic (again, it would cost me $40/day to feed my family breakfast). The staff was great. My one VERY NEGATIVE comment is that they charged $5/bag to store your bag after checkout (if sightseeing for day). I have never heard of such a charge and they refused to wave. That was ridiculous in my opinion. Otherwise - awesome experience. I WILL stay here again and recommend to others. Not as nice as an Embassy Suites (or comparable places), but great deal for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel close to Penn Station, Chelsea and Times Square and this literally put me in the middle of it all. The room was good size (much bigger than the cubbyhole I had last month at the Ramada New Yorker), the breakfast a nice addition (although the waffle maker was always either busy or out of commission) and the service efficient. Only negatives are minor. Cell phone service was non-existent in my 4th floor room and I was unable to print anything from the business center computers, one of which was so infected by viruses that it was completely unusable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise on 35th Street”
Reviews.Author: SIGNALS123
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little hotel located in the Garment District a block from Macy's and 1 and a half blocks from Madision Square Garden. The room was very nicely appointed and had a king size bed, a sitting chair and ottoman. The flat screen TV was small but more than adequate. The included hot breakfast was a treat where one could get scrambled eggs, sausage or ham, waffles, yogurt, cereal, tea, coffee and rolls. It was an outstanding. There was free wifi although it did cut in and out. All in all a great place at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Highly reccomended!”
Reviews.Author: KellyF77
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel as a lovely surprise from my boyfriend for a few days holiday. We didn't know what to expect but the staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and the room was a great size with a huge bed. Lovely bathroom, fresh towels every day, couldn't ask for more! The location of the hotel is brilliant too, right around the corner from macy's so very central. If your'e considering this hotel then go for it its definately worth it :)

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: seasongs5
Reviews.Content: Not as big as pictures make it. Room was dark and small. Beds were comfortable and no bedbugs.It was a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: BethB75205
Reviews.Content: Family vacation with two college kids the second week of January 2011. The location is centrally located. Bought weekly subway passes at Penn Station which is half block away. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast is as good as all the reviews. Rooms are larger than NYC normal. We loaded the mini fridge with drinks and snacks from the Duane Reed at Penn Station down the street. Great restaurants in the area and short walk or subway to Times Square, Chinatown, and Little Itialy. The $5 luggage fee was an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “central but noisy”
Reviews.Author: eugeita
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Wingate and we really appreciate the super position, central and very close to 2 different subway lines. The room was very clean and modern, with a super confortable bed. Breakfast was nice but without variety of food (if you stay there a week, can be booring to eat the same things for days). Can be difficult to sleep, because during some nights, you can hear a big noise from the street due to trucks collecting garbage. I asket to move from the 4th to the 10th floor, but not much changed Unkind and never smiling the girl at front desk, very frendly and helpful the boy, that gave us many good advices about NYC. Top location, with new fixtures at windows and more professional staff at the front desk, Wingate can become a super Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay at a hotel....ever!”
Reviews.Author: Natica85
Reviews.Content: I usually do not review any hotels on here but my stay was so incredibly uncomfortable and the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced that I had to write one. My husband and I made a reservation through the Wingate's website about two months prior to our stay at the hotel. We were traveling with another couple and just staying in New York City for the weekend so we decided to book a double queen room. The reviews on TripAdvisor looked good and the rooms looked spacious and the prices weren't too bad considering we were staying in Mid-town Manhattan. When we arrived at the hotel at check-in we were greeted by the gentleman at the front desk who proceeded to advise us that our room (that we had reserved) had been given away and that the only room available was a 1 King bed room, he said that to accommodate the other couple they would have a air mattress sent up, the gentleman also advised that they would be able to move us to our reserved room the next day. He also advised that the best discount he could do would be to give us a $40.00 discount (mind you we were paying $316 per night) I told him that the price was unacceptable he then said that he would give us $100 discount for the first night. Once we were up in the room we had to call the front desk a couple of times for them to bring up the air mattress, since we were going to dinner they said that they would bring it up before we came back. When we arrived to the hotel room after dinner we saw that the air mattress was a TWIN and was not completely inflated, we spoke to the night manager but he did not do anything about the twin mattress. We were pretty tired so we just slept on it anyway, when we woke up the next morning we realized that the mattress was completely deflated and we were sleeping on the floor. When we advised the managers again they just apologized. At around 3pm the next day we moved into our new room (nobody from the hotel offered to move our luggage) and the rest of the stay was fine. At check out the manager asked us how we liked our stay...once we started telling him our issues we had with the hotel he just responded by saying that the Wingate does not reserve room types, they just reserve the room. After this terrible stay we decided to contact corporate customer service, they were by far the rudest customer service personnel I have ever encountered they took down the complaint and said that someone would contact us before Dec. 21st, December 27th rolled around and we still hadn't heard from the so I decided to contact them again, they reiterated that there was nothing that they would be able to do, I read to them there 100% satisfaction guarantee policy which states that if you are not satisfied with your stay that you do not have to pay for it but they again said that the 100 dollars off they gave us for the first night was enough. All we wanted was for the first night to be compensated but the customer service supervisor said they would no do that. I then asked to be transfered to someone else that I may be able to speak to and the customer service rep said that the only person above her was the president and that I would not be transferred to anyone else. I ended up being VERY disappointed with this horrendous display of customer service. I have traveled all over the world and this by far has been the worst service i have EVER experienced. It is a shame because the hotel room was very nice, but the service was terrible...I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Value”
Reviews.Author: cbc739
Reviews.Content: We just got back from NYC. for a Christmas weekend trip with our teenage girls. We stayed at the Windgate by Wyndham on 35th St. Yes it was a bit further from T.S. but not that much and we used the savings of $300 to spend in the city. Not to mention that the room rate included free internet, continental Breakfast, refrigerator and MIcro. I was looking at other hotels closer to TS that didnt offer internet or breakfast. So you could say that we saved well over $300. We were pleasantly surprised that the room was exactly like the pictures on their web site. The room was very nicely decorated, with ample room for 4 people. The staff was all very helpful and accommodating. And yes the breakfast was actually very good.. I definitely would recommend this hotel to other families who want a good room and not spend a fortune. I thought it was a great value. We spent a total of $575 for 2 nights 12/17-19..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with a few minor inconveinences”
Reviews.Author: kristi11876
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that overall, I would stay at this hotel again...I encountered several positives during my stay that may result in a return trip; however, there were also a few frustrating negatives. First, the positives: 1. The location is outstanding...steps away from Penn Station, all the major subway lines, Macy's and only a few blocks from Times Square. This is an excellent location for seeing the city by foot or by subway. There are two Starbucks nearby, as well as lots of other eateries, shops, etc. 2. The breakfast was excellent--eggs, breakfast meats, waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal, coffee, juices, pastry...the offerings and food quality were superb. One of the best "included" breakfasts I've had at any NY hotel property 3. The staff was very pleasant--we were always greeted with a smile, and any questions were promptly answered. The negatives: 1. The $5 per bag luggage storage fee. I typically travel to NY 5 times per year, and have stayed at many properties within this same class of hotel...I have never been charged a per bag storage fee on the day of checkout. Ultimately, the $15 doesn't break the bank, but based on principle, I would likely select another property just to avoid this fee. Very few travelers leave for the airport immediately upon checking out, and a bag storage fee is an unwelcome added expense at the end of a trip. It is not the standard in NYC, and after paying $289 per night, I don't appreciate the extra $15. 2. Cell phone and internet service were spotty at best. I stayed in room 706, and my cell phone received no service, nor did my fathers (we are both on Verizon). Our room faced the rear of the property, and was exceptionally quiet (which was another positive); but neither of us could make or receive calls or texts in our room. I needed to go to the lobby to make phone calls. Also, the free wi-fi is a bonus at this hotel, but the service was spotty. My connection worked occasionally, but was never strong and frequently faded. It was fine to check an occasional email, but poor overall. If I were a business traveler who needed frequent internet, I definitely would have been frustrated 3. The tv had a decent picture, but the channel selection was subpar; also, the ABC channel was non-existent. This didn't impact my stay, but may challenge folks hoping to see a particular program on ABC. Overall, the hotel met my needs for a quick two night sightseeing trip. I have certainly stayed in better properties in the same price point (try the Staybridge Suites on 40th between 8th and 9th for an amazing hotel stay)...but I have also stayed in far worse. If you find this hotel at a competitive rate, you will likely be happy with your stay. Just be prepared to deal with a few minor inconveinences.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, curtious”
Reviews.Author: Throwstns
Reviews.Content: sebastion was awesome, along with the rest of the staff! great deal for the money. hot breakfast, clean rooms, walking distance to everything. we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Near Macy's, Time Square not Far, Close to the Garden”
Reviews.Author: storminflyer
Reviews.Content: Went with my teenage daughter in the first part of November. We went for a long weekend. The location is good, shopping is close and Time Square is about 7 blocks to the middle. Many eateries around at all price points. The hotel is clean and the breakfast buffet is actually pretty good. Not a bad location and we did not feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: Capodicapi2
Reviews.Content: The best thing was the size of the room (really big for what is NYC), and the location which is great......only 2 blocks away from Empire State. Everything was clean and neat....although the only negative thing is that they refused to provide an early check in; but they did stored our bags, so we had a walk until check in time.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Oliviauk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within a 5 minute walk from Penn Station and less than 10 minutes from Times Square. Ideal for sightseeing, shopping and enjoying New York. Check-in was efficient and staff was very friendly. The room was a very good size and very well equipped (fridge, microwave, coffee maker...). This is the largest hotel room I have had so far in Manhattan. With free Internet access and complimentary breakfast, this hotel is a great choice. They even have a small but well equipped gym in the basement. The only disappointment is that the hotel charges $5 per piece of left luggage. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice rooms, nondescript area, zero Wyndham Rewards points”
Reviews.Author: doughboy41
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers have indicated, the rooms inside this Wyndham are nicely appointed and relatively spacious, unlike some of the shoebox boutique hotels in this price range. We were optimistic after reading other reviews and the rooms did not disappoint. Also as other reviewers have observed, the noisy a/c/heat system is the one thing left incomplete in the remodel that cheapens the feel of the room somewhat. And, while the hotel is reasonably centrally located which makes it a better alternative than those on the east or west edges of town, it is in an area that has kind of an industrial/blah feel to it and there is really nothing nearby in terms of restaurants or cafes or shops. This is not a big deal, but it is in contrast to other hotels in midtown where the immediate vicinity is quite a bit nicer. One other important thing to be aware of (and it took me putting 4 requests into Wyndham corporate to get a non-canned answer) is that you get ZERO credit/points if you book a Wyndham hotel on any of the travel websites like Expedia or Travelocity, etc. The Wyndham website lists all of the hotel brands it controls - in addition to Wyndham they control the Ramada, Days Inn, Wingate, Super 8, Microtel, Travelodge, Howard Johnson, Baymont Inn, Hawthorn Suites and Knights Inn brands. That would have been helpful to know before I spent close to $2,000 on 3 different Wyndham-owned hotels between August and October (this one, Wyndham San Jose and Ramada Monterey). So from now on I will personally have to either find their hotels at an attractive rate on the hotel's actual site, or stay somewhere else. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CTSunseeker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in the Wingate several times through our Wyndham Rewards points system. It is absolutely the best hotel we have stayed at in NYC -- great location, friendly staff, clean, comfortable rooms, fabulous mattresses and bedding, hot complimentary breakfast, and free wi-fi in the rooms. What more can you ask? PLUS we got free parking this time because the front desk couldn't find a record of our reservation after we checked out, when we came back to get our parking ticket stamped -- instead of giving us trouble, they just arranged for us to park for free! We didn't ask for or expect this -- now THAT'S customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NMonaco
Reviews.Content: I live in Connecticut and i frequently travel to NYC for the weekend. I love the Wingate, it has very friendly staff and an amazing location in Midtown Manhattan. I highly recommend staying there, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: debbie22766
Reviews.Content: very very accomodating. very friendly people. let us store our luggage while our room was getting ready. awesome breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In NYC”
Reviews.Author: GizmoDavis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always clean and well appointed. The Front Desk is top rate, especially Kayla, and always makes me feel that I am at my home away from home. The rooms are very clean. I have stayed here regularly for more than 3 years. This is one of the best deals in NYC and I have stayed at many hotels previously.

Reviews.Title: “The Wingate was a ok hotel to stay overall with + & -.”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 9 nights from July 20th-29th. Pros: -Good Location, walking distance to touristic venues and public transportation. -Free breakfast. -Free Internet. -Microwave+mini fridge. -Umbrella. -Comfortable bed and sheets. Cons: -Luggage hold fee $5 per/bag (backpack free). -AC/Vent extremely loud (you will need ear plugs). I got a room on the 15th floor with window facing 35th street even though I asked for a quiet room on the highest possible floor during my booking. 35th street can get noisy with truck backing up and trash getting pickup.
