I called and complained to the front desk and they told me that the will inform the management to see if they could get me a more quiet room, but I never heard anything back from them. -The bathroom had a shower curtain that smell damp clothing after 2/3 days use. The curtain was changed promptly when I requested it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reunion at the Wingate!”
Reviews.Author: cathyblack550
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked 2 rooms at the Wingate for a Reunion in July. The hotel staff were friendly and very accommodating. The rooms were clean and spacious, beds very comfortable. Hot breafast was convenient too! Location was perfect as I had a sister coming in from Port Authority and girlfriends coming in from Penn Station both nearby. They had a private car service that came within 10 minutes for a pleasant ride to the airport. Will make this a must next time we get together.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND NICE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: mumchie
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time stayng at the Wingate.I found is is in a great location near Macys,Madison Square Garden and a subway station just a short walk away. The rooms were spacious and bathrooms were clean and well maintained.Fridge and microwave in room very convienient.Would stay again if I go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Melinda73
Reviews.Content: This hotel may look small on the outside but the 2 double beds room we were given was clean and a good size. We arrived jet-lagged at 7am on a Sunday and although check-in was not until 3pm, we were given our room straightaway (an email we sent a week prior requesting an early check-in helped). Our room was facing towards the back of the hotel so there was no traffic noise, however, the air conditioning unit in our room was quite loud. The hotel provide a hot continental breakfast and the staff in both the restaurant and hotel were friendly. The hotel is a block from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and a short walk to Macy's department store and numerous cafes and restaurants. We walked to Times Square every evening and felt safe coming back late. There were 2 Starbucks' stores on either end of the street where we got free wi-fi access. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay that I would go to again and again!”
Reviews.Author: punkybush
Reviews.Content: This hotel had friendly service, great decor, perfect location, great value, clean rooms, wonderful breakfast, complimentary paper, comfortable beds, nice bathroom...no complaints at all. My husband, friends and I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we are in NYC. Thanks for a comfortable place to stay away from home!

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziyaonurkorkut
Reviews.Content: excellent staff, perfect location, quite, large room has everything you need..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel located in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fredimondi
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time to stay over night in NYC and had a excellent Hotel Located in Very Nice Area in Manhattan's Midtown with excellent staff and The Room was top floor with a balcony overlooked NYC The Room Was very Clean, Quiet, Cool, And is Walking distance to everything in Midtown. I would Recommend this Hotel to any of my friends and family and the Complimentary Continental Breakfast was more then Continental it had so many choices to choose from they should just call it a full breakfast. What a Great Experience Thank you all very much to the staff at Wingate by Wyndham

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff & location! AND you get breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TxGirl1980
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 friends stayed here mid-June for 4 nights. The hotel staff was really nice....took our pictures, helped us find places to eat, etc. The breakfast was a great bonus....waffles, eggs, sausage, toast, bagels, fruit, muffins, mini-cinnamon rolls, juices. It was the same every day but it was nice not to have to pay for another meal. The location was really convenient & we never felt like we weren't safe....Starbucks is on the corner (saw Guy Fieri there), a good restaurant across the street, good subway line (up to Starbucks and over a block), TS not too far. The room was clean and updated. Nice tv, nice firm beds, desk, mini-fridge, microwave, safe large enough to hold a laptop and more, iron, A/C worked good. Bathroom was really spacious.....I was excited to have a whole counter in NYC.....and housekeeping gave us lots of towels. Our room had a long mirror, a big bathroom mirror and one above the counter that held the coffee maker and stuff.....that's important for people fixing hair and putting on makeup at the same time. :) For NYC, I thought the room was a good size for 3 people. It was VERY quiet and we slept great. We never heard housekeeping, other guest, elevators, etc. I think there are only 6, maybe 8, rooms on each floor. We were in room 801. My friend arrived first and upon getting to our room the inside lock was not working. They sent the engineer up to the room to look at it. He couldn't fix it at that moment so they moved us to another floor right away. After we checked out they held our bags for us so we wouldn't have to haul them around the city. $5 per bag. Backbacks or small bags are free. You get a baggage tag & they are kept in a room. My only complaint, which isn't the hotel's fault, is the subway running under the building. Anytime we were in the bathroom we felt like we were swaying. It wasn't like that in the room though. The swaying was in China Town and in different parts of NYC, so it's not just the hotel. It's just something you have to get used to I guess & I don't remember that last year. Overall, the hotel was great and I would most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: bennyt2
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews state, its a great little hotel and within a walk to B and H photo store, the main reason for visiting New York. Definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: patmetz23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wingate by Wyndham Hotel in Midtown Manhattan for several nights. We were pleasantly surprised by how clean the room was. They let us keep our backpacks there until check in with no charge since we arrived around 11 a.m. Our room had a king bed with all the amenities and a sound machine. We had a small frig and a microwave which was nice to keep water in since it was 90 degrees while we visited. The ac worked great. We enjoyed the free breakfast buffet and the employees were very nice and helpful when we asked for directions. The location of the hotel was great. About five walkable blocks to the Port Authority bus terminal and one block from the subway and Macy's. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My newest NYC gem”
Reviews.Author: Drucillaisadiva
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this gem right in the heart of Midtown. The staff greeted us friendly and the rooms were clean. The promotional rate I received were also very good considering the location. I will most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: SaysWho
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled, so had an unexpected last minute stay here. We were greeted with a bag of popcorn to pop in our room, which was equipped with a coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge. While neither of us had cell phone reception (which NEVER happens), but the hotel does offer free wifi to make up for that-- as well as free long distance calls from the room phone. Breakfast was good- hot food, as well as yogurt, etc which is served in their nice restaurant area on the first floor. Front desk very friendly and helpful. We were able to store our luggage there after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “OK but tend to overbook and bump you off to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: RemyVidal
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there 5 nights last week - should have been 6. Upon arriving from the UK at 8pm with luggage and kids in tow, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and they were sending us somewhere else. Last thing one needs at 1am UK time when tired and jetlagged kids is to be told that. Had booked late Jan/early Feb so can't see how my room should be overbooked, especially since I am a corporate customer from a next-door NYC company on a private visit. Chatting to colleagues around the office, they have already experienced this before. So book at your peril. For those who think breakfast is great: get out more. It's on a the lousy side of acceptable. Great location that's for sure but only very average on balance.

Reviews.Title: “the little brother of hotels”
Reviews.Author: johno95
Reviews.Content: This little brother wants to compete with the big boys, but needs to take care of the basics first. The accessible room was just that, but the shower head stayed up, not adjustable by someone sitting in the tub. The music from the outdoor garden was a but loud. I spilled coffee in the corridor outside our room. Despite a phone call, it was never cleaned up. A sign in the room announced that, under their green program, towels would not be replenished until we ended our stay. I was shocked. Then I noticed another sign that stated that if we wanted a towel replaced, just throw it on the floor. So we followed that policy keeping two bath towels on the holders, throwing greater soiled towels on the floor. Possibly in search of a greater tip, the maid gave us fresh towels all around. Some visitors mentioned the ice machine. Although just outside our door, dispensing ice, it didn't bother us. The complimentary breakfast was exhaustive and ambitious. Three young men ran around and replenished things. Guests kept trying to make waffles on their own as the employees watched from a distance, the griddles would get all stuck up, then the assistants would sweep down and clean out the griddles. There were no drinking glasses in the room at all. I called for some, and they brought them up several hours later. I expected glass, but they brought cardboard. My wife reminded me that often glass is not used. In a hotel like this? Things were nicely decorated, but kept simple.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: JGM418
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel within walking distance of Penn Station, near the subway, that was reasonably priced and included breakfast. This was the place! The hotel staff was helpful, the room was a good size, everything was clean. The view is not great - many storefronts - but not a problem for us. The room had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot and coffee - but no cups of any kind. The restaurant next door had live music on Saturday night and it was hard to hear the movie we rented because of it - plus the movie volume would not go very high at all. But they ended at 11:30 so sleeping was not a problem. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bobomejor
Reviews.Content: I really cannot recommend this place enough. This was my first trip to Manhattan (my wife had been previously, but not for several years) and I was very excited. The reason I chose this hotel was because it was close to all of the requisite touristy things I wanted to see as a first-time visitor to NYC. Plus, we rode the Megabus from Boston, and it drops off just a few blocks away. You really can't ask for a better location in Midtown, since there is so much to see and do withing walking distance (i.e. The Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, the Theater District) or just a quick trip on the subway (the Penn Station subway platform is only a 5-minute walk away and the 1 train will take you to lots of great places, including lower Manhattan to board the Statue of Liberty ferry... or uptown to Lincoln Center, etc.) The complimentary breakfast is fantastic, and included juices, pastries, eggs, bacon, etc. My wife and I were pretty impressed. The bed was comfy and we had no problems with it. The TV was a nice flat-screen, though our unit was having some issues with volume levels (it wouldn't go high enough to hear some programs). The bathroom had a nice big countertop and plenty of place to put things. The shower and bathtub were fairly ordinary, but the showerhead had multiple settings, which is always a plus. Our room was quite spacious and had a refrigerator. It's easy enough to walk to a nearby deli or store and grab some drinks for the fridge. We ordered pizza from Amadeus Pizza on 8th Ave. between 31st and 30th (delicious, by the way... and you can order and pay online) and kept the leftovers in the fridge too. The hotel also offers free wi-fi (which worked fine while we were there), which is great to have when you want to plan some last-minute activities. One thing I especially liked: the hotel will hold your luggage for free if you get there before check in. We got in about 11:45 a.m., and they held our bags while we took off for the Statue of Liberty. Picking up our bags when we got back around 6 p.m. was easy and our room was ready to go. When we checked out, they charged us $5 per suitcase to hold our bags for the day (I had emailed them before the trip, and they were very upfront about the charge, so there was no surprise. They only charged us to hold the larger bags, and did not charge us to also hold my backpack and my wife's purse.). The view is unimpressive (ours was of the back of the adjacent restaurant), but we weren't in the room that often. Who goes to NYC and spends the whole time in the room anyway? The only critiques I can give this place is that the restaurant has live music that gets kind of loud at night, though it didn't really bother me... and cell phones basically DO NOT work in the building. I think the hotel offers free phone service because of that, but I only called in when I was out exploring and my wife was still inside taking a nap (I knew she wouldn't get reception on her cell, so I just called the room phone). I would definitely stay here again if I was back in the city and wanted an affordable place to stay for a few nights. Sure, it might be fun to splurge on a luxury hotel sometime... but this is great for a purely sightseeing trip. We had a great time in NYC and I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarkPitch
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights, the hotel is well positioned in the city, within easy walking distance of Penn station, times square, and loads of others. The room was comfortable and clean. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off...stay at the Hotel Metro or New Yorker in this area!”
Reviews.Author: MargaretPowell
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find our safe locked, no shower curtain, a light out in bathroom and a clunking humming ice machine right outside our door that gurgled and thumped all night! Reception could not get us a shower curtain until during next day! Only highlight was breakfast and cheerful staff there! Generally dingy and each floor is small and pokey and awful...clean though...I have stayed at Hotel Metro before in same area and this was a much nicer hotel! Wingate is close to Penn Station but New Yorker Hotel is closer and would probably stay there or Metro next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: FDR1031
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Extremely well located on a non-busy street yet one block north of Penn Station, Madison Garden; 7 minute walk to TImes Square, 10-12 to Broadway. The staff was extremely welcoming, friendly, upbeat. The hotel sits on a very narrow plot, so there are only 5 guest rooms per floor, which is a good thing. We stayed on the backside of the hotel, room 1701, and there was no discernable street or outside noise. The breakfast was OK/adequate. The only negative was the A/C system. When it kicks in, it is realtively loud. I'm a lite sleeper and it woke me up when it turned out to maintain a cooler temp. The second night I ran the fan only. That being said, one of the 2 other hotels we stayed at on this same trip, the A/C system was just as loud; and it would not prevent me from recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is considered a 2 1/2 star hotel???”
Reviews.Author: palofcyruss
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was really surprised that this was a 2 1/2 star hotel. I would rate it at least a 3. We had nice friendly service at the front desk and the rooms are exactly as shown in the pictures on their website. We paid $133/night. The breakfast consisted of the following: make-your-own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, cereal, bagels (with cream cheese, jam, etc.), mini muffins and croissants, toast (whole wheat and white), cranberry, orange, and apple juices, coffee and tea, whole oranges and apples. There are two free computers (with printers) in the lounge area and you can make free local calls from there. The bathroom was very clean as was the room. I gave the room my "white-sock" test and it passed. There was only one drawback: on the first night, my friend pulled back her bedspread to examine the sheets on her bed. There was what appeared to be yellow stains in a few places. We were not sure if the sheets were new and just washed, or left on from the previous guests. We're assuming they were permanent stains that can't come off. Anyways, we called the front desk and they provided us with a new set of sheets. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: AnLuArC
Reviews.Content: Comparing to what you find in Manhattan this hotel was a 5*. Clean, excelent location, breakfast included, etc! The Rooms - quite big, clean, well decorated! A little bit noisy during the night if you get a room facing the street... you can't complain because you're actually in the centre of the island that never sleeps! The bathrooms were perfect as well! The staff - polite enough The Location - you can see one of the entrances of Macy's from the hotel's front door. The street is not very beautifull or clean but go to the first corner and you'll have the 7th! Than you'll see Subway entrance, Madison Square, Times Square... your really in the centre! The Breakfast - wasn't very good to be true... but it was good enough to start the day! And you WON'T find a better breakfast at Starbucks or MacDonald's! I definitely recommend this hotel! When I come back to NY I'll stay there if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but Some Walls Too Thin”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near several major public transit access points, including Penn Station. The room was comfortable and very clean, and appeared to have been recently constructed or remodeled. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The small refrigerator (which was nearly empty, rather than filled with high-priced snacks) and microwave oven were appreciated. Staff were all helpful and friendly. However, there were a number of problems: - Walls are VERY thin. The neighbors' conversations in their rooms and all the activity occurring in the hallway were audible in my room. Some street noise, such as garbage trucks, could be heard from outside as well, but it was much less annoying than the noise from other occupants of the hotel. Earplugs were provided, but they don't help when you are trying to watch tv or hold your own conversation (or if you want to be sure to hear the alarm clock go off in the morning). - Shower pressure was pathetic. - The shower curtain had an off smell when I arrived and needed to be changed. This is the kind of detail that housekeeping staff should recognize without prompting. - Housekeeping forgot to leave cups in the room for several days, so I mistakenly thought cups were not provided as a policy of the hotel (foolish of me since there was a coffeemaker in the room). - Exercise room is very small with just a few pieces of equipment. The equipment all appears to be new. There is a large multi-component weights machine that was actually too complicated to figure out how to use, despite the instructions posted on the wall (and I've been using weights machines for years). Would consider returning if I could get a very low price again (I visited during a low point in the year for tourism). But would probably look elsewhere, due to the thin walls, if only their standard rates were being offered.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Trip to the City Made Great by Wingate”
Reviews.Author: travelingnewsmom
Reviews.Content: I wasn't in NYC long and had to spend a great deal of my time actually working in my room and was thrilled with the setupâ€”a huge, cushy bed with soft linens and an ergonomical chair for the desk (though I never sat in itâ€”I prefer working from the bed with the laptop on my lap). A frig made it easy to keep my special drinks refrigerated and I was all set. I didnâ€™t discover my favorite part of the room until 5 hours later when I was getting ready to go out, needed to shower and discovered the coolest shower head ever. This thing worked magic with the water, working into a power stream that felt more like a back and scalp massage than any other shower head Iâ€™ve ever used. Iâ€™m tempted to order one for my own home. It was that good and was easily my favorite part of my room. I met up with come friends in Wingateâ€™s bar/restaurant downstairs and ordered up some drinks. I ate some of the best crab cake of my life and over the next couple hours enjoyed great service and conversation. The staff was great, both friendly and helpful. This hotel made my visit to the city WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Cyndee_7
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for two nights and were pleasantly surprised. We did have a good "group rate" for a function my daughter was attending, which also allowed us to store luggage for free, so that was nice. We liked the free breakfast, and on both mornings it was well stocked, although a little overcrowded. In any case, there is a cheap and yummy bagel place next door and Starbucks on either end of the street, so it's easy to round out your meal if you don't find exactly what you want. The rooms are big, although the view stinks. Everything was clean and the shower was great too. The heater was really noisy -- that would be my biggest complaint. And bring your own water bottles--the ones in the fridge cost $5 each. The best part was the employees--every maid or maintenance person smiled and said hello and the front desk people were friendly and helpful too. Overall it was a good value in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Central Yes, Nice Rooms, Problems some”
Reviews.Author: dr_evil_dad
Reviews.Content: This is in the heart of the old garment district, it's in a safe area and easy access to Subway and Penn Station/Madison Sq. Garden. My son and I traveled there for a trip to see the sights unfortunately our room had problems and we had a backing view to an old factory. If you're looking for a 5 star place, this isn't it but it is very nice as a 3 star. Morning breakfast does get crowded as it seems that this place appeals to large groups, like 50-60 teenagers on a broadway weekend. All in all a nice place to stay, just don't expect room service and it is small by NYC standards. We had burnt out light bulbs and a flakey switch (buzz, whurr, zap) in the bathroom. These are things that I would have thought would be taken care of by the Management before somebody were allowed to be in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and central!”
Reviews.Author: SurahE
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really clean, small but it doesn't really matter! They dont do room service, which we thought was kind of annoying but sure you might not! When we were leaving we had a LOT of luggage, (we shopped loads!) probably about 14 bags between 5 of us. And we left them with the front desk while we got lunch before our taxi came. Anyway they were all on 2 trollies. When we came back to get the taxi all the bags were loaded in for us, and stupidly we thought they had put ALL the bags on... went to the airport and uh oh wheres about 3 of our bags!!? Rang the hotel and they said ' oh theyre here'.. not much help. So we had to pay for another taxi to bring them to the airport (another $60).. Which was REALLY annoying!! We stayed there before in November 07 and thought it was a great hotel so apart from that incident our thoughts were the same. Breakfast changed from the previous time we were there (there wasn't as much variety), and the place was VERY crowded in the morning. The rooms were spotless and the beds were really comfortable. Its in a really central location, about 5 minutes walk from times square and right beside subways etc. We were one the 6th floor facing onto the road and got a great nights sleep every night, so we didnt really notice any noise. All in all a pretty awesome, clean and friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1006
Reviews.Content: We never expected to find a hotel room that was spacious and reasonably priced in addition to being very quiet at night. Had all the amenities we needed, two minute walk to MSG, and a wonderful full breakfast as well. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAZ22SCOTLAND
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel between 31 dec - 4th jan 2010,hotel is located in a ideal location with there being only a 10 minute walk to major transport links penn station and port authority and the tourist attractions times sqaure and madison square garden.The hotel and rooms therself ware clean,tidy and really all you need for a short break to new york.The staff were very friendly and helpful as i often asked them for directions. The minor faults with the hotel were the loud music from downstairs bar although not too loud that you couldnt get to sleep ,it was noticeable and the charge for holding on to your bags if you were checking out but had time to spare in city before flying home etc. The charge although small at $10.00 i thought was unfair and could be done free as a nice gesture. Overall this hotel is a gem and well worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “The Wingate is a cool hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ibreal2334
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wingate Dec. 25 - 31, 2009. We cancelled other accoms at a Hyatt because they didn't have the good reviews that the Wingate did. The hotel is a newer looking, 18 story building on a narrow street between 7th and 8th avenues. Those two streets have the subway lines running north-south. So you are only a short NYC block from two main subway lines. We were on the top floor, corner unit. We had a nice little corner balcony which we had time to step out on day one and the last day when it snowed. We reviewed many places for location, amenities and pricing. Wingate was tough to beat. Our room had a small bedroom with a small living room. The bedroom had a huge Cal King that our 6 year old slept in with Mom and Dad as planned. The 24 year old son removed the pad from the sleeper sofa and slept on the floor. The rooms were fairly large for NYC. The bedroom and living room were separated by sliding wood/glass doors. Perfect for the 24 year old to stay up late. Their business center had two PC's and printers which we used a couple of times with no issues. Free wireless internet was great. We used that each day via our laptop in our room. Our room was very quiet except for the occasional siren or trash truck outside. The heater in the room worked perfect, the water pressure and temps in the shower were perfect. Some days we left a few bucks and a note requesting extra towels, coffee cups and whatever else and everything was provided when we returned. Housekeeping left us notes, thanked us for the tips, made up towels and our daughter's critters on the bed. The fridge and coffemaker were very handy. Plenty of outlets for our accessories to charge at night. The restaurant had a nice meal each morning from 6 or 7 until 9:50AM. Yes, its supposed to be 10AM, but they stop serving and start cleaning and chairs are up on the tables by 10:05. Make your own waffles on two waffle makers, they provide scrambled eggs, breads, cold cereals, bagels, toast, apples oranges, patty sausages, coffee, juice machines, etc. More good stuff: the location! Besides the proximity to the subways, all Midtown fun is minutes away! Empire St Bldg, Times Sq, Macys, Rockefeller, Madison Sq Garden, Penn station and much more. Starbucks at each end of the block, eateries everywhere. We hit Upper West and East sides, Central Park, Financial District, Battery Park, SoHo, Greenwich all a short ride on the subway. There is a new bagel and sandwich place next door that was great. The Blueberry cream cheese is awesome. The hotel held our checked luggage for $5 per bag on our last day. Carry on bags free. We are so glad we stayed there. To stay close to Times Sq is just nuts, it is sooo crowded, noisy and bright. The front desk was helpful. Our first night in town, it was late and we needed to eat. The cool front desk guy suggested Friday's. He was right, it was open, but what a ripoff. Go anywhere to eat except there or any other chain place near Times Sq. That meal was our most expensive of the trip and it was only for burgers/fries, chicken sandwich and salads. $23 for a burnt chicken sandwich?! Even our waiter joked that the place was about quantity, not quality. After that, we ate at cool mom and pop places for our meals and liked them all. So if I was to try and pick out some low lites about the Wingate, I would say the street and hotels on it are not as scenic as say uptown luxury. We had to keep asking for coffee cups in our room and a 4th set of towels, extra sheet for the mattress on the floor, more shampoo. If we paid a tip and wrote a note, housekeeping remembered. If not, then we had to call for the goods when we got back to our room late at night. The shower drain was open, no stopper. So on day two the small hotel soap fell in it and then the water backed up. We left a note about it and that night the problem was fixed. One night our 6 year old played around with the buttons on the room safe and it locked up on us. We called the front desk late and the 'engineer' was gone for the day, he'd be back the next day. The front desk clerk mentioned that he thought the lock would time out and then we could enter our original code. That worked and we were saved! The price of the Wingate was maybe $20 - $30 higher per night than maybe some other comps, but it was worth it to us. We were happy that we didn't pay the same or more for a smaller room, especially closer to Time Sq where things are generally more expensive. Thats it. Good family trip with great accoms! PS, The dept. store Xmas window displays were as awesome as everyone says they are. Once we saw our first one, we made it a point to see them all. Macys, Bloomies, Lord & Taylor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased!”
Reviews.Author: JMD212
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay over the Thanksgiving holiday! The room was clean, spacious, and quiet. The location can't be beat...so close to all the attractions! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Clean-comfy-reasonable,”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pals_87
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean..seems newly renovated. Room size was big compared to other city hotel rooms. Bed was comfortable. Water was hot. Service friendly. Full hot breakfast included. Location is 1/2 block from Macy's. Convenient to shows, Times Square, Madison Sq Garden....If you like to walk...walkable to museums, Little Italy, SoHo. Subway stop nearby. Megabus from Boston, Philadelphia and DC stop 1 block away. Easy walk to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with Helpful, Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: berricks
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel the week before thanksgiving and enjoyed the stay. The room was quiet and comfortable. We were on the 7th floor in 701. View of the building next door was not much to see but for all the reviews talking about garbage trucks and noise the hotel was not bad at all. You are in the middle of New York so there's bound to be some noise. Just a few blocks to Times Square, close to a couple subway lines and Penn station. The hot breakfast is very good with helpful staff, waffles, eggs, cereal, etc. Much easier than taking the kids out for breakfast. Coffee was not great but there's a Starbucks 100 yards away. The best part was the friendly and helpful front desk. We had booked online and must have made a mistake with the checkout date. After talking with the front desk they accommodated us for one more night even thought the hotel was completely sold out that night. That's service you don't find at every hotel. Very thoughtful and a real help since we messed up the checkout date.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and comfort at the best quality/price!”
Reviews.Author: DanielaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. If you like smaller hotels with attentive service, this is the place! The whole staff is very nice, polite , smiling at all times, from front desk to housekeepers, breakfst staff etc. Breakfast is included and is very good, including good coffee. Rooms are clean but a bit small.But who cares, we are in NY to visit and shop, not to stay in the room! The location is perfect, litterally 2 blocks from Penn station, Macy's, Empire State building etc. We even walked all the way to Times Square, Broadway and Central park (need time for that however!) I will go back and recommend it anytime! The price makes it even more attractive : app. 250$US for room with 2 double bed) .

Reviews.Title: “Found a gem in New York City!!”
Reviews.Author: Simone0711
Reviews.Content: Having travelled from South Africa and having had to book on-line (and we all know what's posted on the net is not always the same in reality!!) I need to let any other future travellers to New York know...I found a gem!!! This hotel is just a few blocks from Time Square, really well priced and includes a good complimentary breakfast that gives you a great start to the day. The room is a good size for New York, modern and spotless, with a marble bathroom including a bath and shower. With free internet I could update my Facebook to let all know back home what we were experiencing in NY and overall the hotel has added to the whole fantastic experience of New York.....

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy, NOISY, Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TERLondon
Reviews.Content: Please DO NOT stay at the Wingate - unfortunately, this is one of my company's preferred hotels and this is my second attempt (my preferred options were all booked out) at staying in this hotel and the last. When booked, I requested a quiet room as my previous experience had taught me not to get a room overlooking the street as the garbage trucks literally roll up and down this street ALL night and the noise is incredible. On arriving I was told I had a room in the front of the hotel - although I was reassured that because it was on the 18th floor - it wouldn't be noisy. My experience from last time told me that this was an incorrect statement. I requested a room at the back and was given a double that looked a bit dusty and unloved. I was informed they were having a halloween party that night and that it could be noisy - now I was prepared for some noise but this is ridiculous - a full on club is now booming in my room. I asked to move - they are now 'full'. I was informed the party would be going on until 4am. I have now been up for 24 hours with no sleep. I am now going to leave.

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: mabeauty
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel. the staff that helped with our check in was very friendly. i guess our room wasn't ready yet so we wait a bit more than 30min but the wait was good coz she end up upgrading us to their clean air room with a refrigerator. no microwave though. we were on the 22 floors and noise was not an issue. we had king bed that were big enough for a family of 5. the room is a little small though not much room for our big luggage. but the place is very close to major attractions. we walk to timesquare, macy's and the empire state building. breakfast was free for us but just continental. internet is free. if u forget the privacy notice on the door they cleaned your room immaculately.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: LuvTollers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to attend an event in the garment district. The hotel is easy to find from Penn Station. It is elegant yet unpretentious. It not very big. I believe it has 18 floors but only 6 rooms per floor. We stayed again the next time we went to NYC, and will stay here whenever we can. If you're looking for a decent hotel with nice rooms with easy access to Penn Station, this one is great.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sscott167
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted politely and since the rooms weren't ready they checked our bags for us so we could go have lunch. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. They served a hot breakfast each morning that was good. For the price and location, I would highly recommend this hotel; we will stay there on our next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “New York City”
Reviews.Author: Beth529
Reviews.Content: New York City, April 2009 My husband and I finally made it New York City this Spring and had a wonderful trip. We stayed at the Wyndham Midtown which was very clean and convenient to all attractions. It's a rehabbed place so the bedding & carpeting was new. Continental breakfast was included in our stay & they have a little patio in the back. The bathroom was very spacious which is unusual for NYC. We flew into JFK from St. Louis (Lambert) and then took the A-train & subway to Penn Station. We then walked to our hotel. The hop on hop off bus was perfect for our first two days there. The views from the top are amazing. After that we used our Metro Card for the subway which was pretty easy to use. We spent one day at Ellis Island & had purchased our ferry tickets online in advance. We got last minute Letterman tickets, but the highlight of our trip for me was the Broadway show "Blithe Spirit" featuring Angela Lansbury. The food at Dallas Bar-b-que in Times Square was delicious & inexpensive. It's a fun place to visit,, but wear good walking shoes and stop & pick up a map at the Visitor Center when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: kellis820
Reviews.Content: Good Location- close to subway, manhattan attractions Many free extras: WIFI, HOT Breakfast Great Bar off of Lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jediannie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really great. It's within a block of Penn Station & Macy's, walking distance to Times Square & the Empire State Building & some decent restaurants too. The hotel was very clean, although the bathroom did have a slight smell of mildew & some minor mold was growing in the shower. I loved having a microwave & refrigerator & the breakfast spread was really good. Eggs & some kind of meat (either sausage or bacon) a variety of pastries & breads (bagels, english muffins & sliced bread) & waffles too, along with cereal & yogurt & fruit. My only complaint is that if you come to breakfast after 9 a.m., you have slim pickings for breads & the waffle mix was usually gone. My sister & I would definitely stay here again! Oh yes, and Sacia at the front desk was very helpful & friendly. I've read complaints that the hotel was noisy, but they do everything they can to make the noise minimal, they offer earplugs & white noise machines in the rooms. We were in 1105 (away from the street) so we didn't hear any street noise at all. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in mid-town, excellent hotel value”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Found this highly rated hotel through trip advisor and booked several months in advance to take advantage of special. The location was excellent, short walk to shopping (Macy's around the corner) Times Square and Hell's Kitchen restaurants. Easy access to Penn Station with direct connecting trains to EWR Newark Airport Extensive breakfast included for three of us. Highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “??? Was I in same hotel at all???”
Reviews.Author: ciara33
Reviews.Content: Having just read andrews post i really had to question had i been in the same hotel. I stayed at the Wingate last october and loved it so much we are travelling back there next month on October 9th for 5 nights. The hotel is lovely.. the staff are so helpful.. the location was perfect for us as we spend a LOT of our time in Macy's. You get a complimentary breakfast, great to set you up for a days shopping. There are 4 of us sharing a double double room and we had plenty of room (would of had loads more if we hadn't bought half of new york). Can't wait to return to NY and stay at the Wingate.

Reviews.Title: “the rat motel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW5
Reviews.Content: the motel was awful, holes in the walls rats everywhere I DO NOT recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: AustinAllie
Reviews.Content: Can not imagine staying anywhere else. The staff was so courteous, helpful and friendly. The room, location and overall service was excellent. Not one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: nathalieroberts
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 9 people, ranging from 3yrs old to 57yrs old. We booked through hotels.com the same day and obtained the rooms at $165/night tax included. We were wrapping up a vacation in an RV and called the hotel concierge to ask for assistance in finding a parking lot in Manhattan that could accommodate a 30foot long RV. The concierge was extremely helpful, called various places and find us a place about 12 blocks away. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly & serviceable. The rooms were small, but larger than some NYC rooms I've stayed in. Most importantly the rooms were very clean, the beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was very clean and modern and though only with a shower, it was a larger shower. The breakfast was good, I had one of the best omelets. The location was great for going uptown or downtown. Overall, I was expecting something mediocre for the price and it turned out to be a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Sacia at front desk was extremely helpful!”
Reviews.Author: kengs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate last week. I traveled with my husband and two teenagers. We had a great stay. Our room was quiet and clean. We found Sacia to be very helpful at the front desk. She was always friendly and ready to help us out. We loved NYC and would stay at the Wingate again.

Reviews.Title: “Were given the worst room in hotel, even though we booked 7 months ago”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Watson08
Reviews.Content: We were flying back from our Honeymoon on Mexico to Europe and decided to stay in NY to do some clothes shopping. We booked this hotel as it is close to my wifes favourite shop (Macys), the reviews were good and it was aroun $100 per night cheaper than other simialr hotels. We arrived pretty tired after a 5 hour flight. The front desk was quite but the receptionist had messed up the PC and needed 5 mins of button clicking before he could say hello. We were given room 205. The room was pretty small, the bathroom was very strange, like a walkin shower with a plastic seat in it. The toilet seat was fixed down and was a bit hard to sit still while doing the toilet! The TV was on the wall at the side near the pillows making it hard for 2 people to watch while in bed. The bed sheet had some sort of plastic material inside it?? We then realise it was a room for disabled people. At around 8pm, the disco started outside. The music was very loud and the people chatting and screaming was even louder. We lay awake until 1 am and then I asked the front desk for a room change. We booked the room in Dec 08 so I thought we should be entitled to a better room. I later heard many people complaining about noise and overheard the receptionist saying the hotel had overbooked and they were trying to sort it out. The front desk didn't seem that interested in questions. Certainly no where near as friendly as the Affinia 50 we stayed in last year. We were given a room change the next day to a room at the front of the hotel. This room was much nicer and much bigger (although I expected the disabled room to be bigger not smaller). The TV was at the end of the bed, the bed itself was very comfortable and big, bathroom was nice although the toilet seat wasn't fixed down but could live with it. There were earplugs in this room but we weren't sure why....until 10pm when the trash lorry and companies started working. It was fairly noisy but we could sleep through it. If we were given the second room to start with, we would have gave the hotel 7/10 but the 1st room was so bad and we booked so early that it left us with a sour taste. There are many hotels in the area that would be quieter, I would check them out first. I can't comment on breakfast. We got to sleep late due to the noise and breakfast is finished by 9 so we went to the ticktock dinner on 8th...it was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Worth the Stay !”
Reviews.Author: catchick3
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 teenagers (age 16 and 18) and I stayed at the Wingate for 3 nites last week. We had a great experience. Staff at check-in and check-out were very nice. Our room was ready when we showed up at 1 pm. The breakfast was great (but you better get down there way before 9 am or the pickings will be slim !) Our room was nice, roomy and quite. We were on the 16th floor on the back side of the building which I think helped with the lack of street noise. We came in after dark each night and did not feel scared walking the street back to the hotel. Only about a block or two away from Macys flagship store and Herald Square and only about a 10 to 15 minute walk to Time Square. When we go back to NYC, we'll definitely stay at the Wingate again !

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel, Good Location Next to Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: BigDawg5582
Reviews.Content: I looked at MANY hotels on this site before booking. I had heard that there were bed bug problems in some places in NY. I also needed something affordable where I could get uptown or downtown very easily. WIngate was the place. Room was very clean, LCD TV, safe that can hold a laptop, free internet, continental breakfast. I didn't hear any outside noise like one of the reviews said here. Part of that migth have been because I was very tired when I would get back to the room. If you are not very exhausted everytime you come back to your hotel in NYC, then you are really wasting your time in the city. Also, they have a little "radio" that you can turn on and listen to the ocean, birds, and 5 or 6 other "nature" noises. Breakfast was not amazing, but good enough for "free" They had hot items like sausage eggs, ham, bacon and waffles. Elevators are fast. I know in some hotels in NY in the past, I have had trouble with slow elevators. I read another review about providing clean towels. Everytime I came back to the room after leaving in the morning, I had clean towels, linens, and the bed was made, so no problem with that. If you want to save some money, want a nice hotel in a good location, this is definitely it. Oh, did I mention that the rooms are a nice size with plenty of space for a hotel in NYC at these rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rkw0211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tastefully decorated, clean, and comfortable hotel. Our room was the standard two double bed room with a closet, small bathroom, and a window at the end. The view was less than spectacular, however we were on the top floor (18th) so we could not see the street below, just the building across from us. The staff was nice, they greeted us when we walked in the door, answered our questions politely, and the guy in the breakfast room quickly replenished things when needed. The hotel was updated and modern with nice furnishings and modern decor. The location was also very good. Although it was not on a "main" street, it was only about 5-8 blocks away from Times Square, 3 blocks from Macy's, and 2 blocks from the nearest subway station. Overall, this hotel was very nice for the money and is very adequate for a weekend in New York. I don't recommend this hotel for those looking to spend lots of time in the hotel, it doesn't have lots and lots of amenities, however if you are taking a trip to see the sights of NYC and just want a clean, comfortable, modern hotel with a good location, this is an excellent pick.

Reviews.Title: “An Apartment, with a maid”
Reviews.Author: tvd285250
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 3 hours early for check in and the hotel didnâ€™t have a problem checking us in. The staff wasnâ€™t pleasant at check in, but they werenâ€™t rude either. The room was a double queen room nothing special. It was a normal hotel room, it was clean, the beds were one step below a stone slate and the A/C sound like a small plane, but it was cold and thatâ€™s what counts. We had no view, but that doesnâ€™t matter because you shouldnâ€™t be in your room much anyway. We had a flat screen TV, a cold frig and a safe. The overall hotel was clean and neat nothing ordinate. The reason I said itâ€™s like an apartment is because the staff didnâ€™t really care about what you were doing. The hotel didnâ€™t have a hospitability desk to help you out to find things or give you advice. You kind of just come and go as you please. The Hotel is located between two of the cityâ€™s main Subway hubs on 34th ST and down the street from Macy and the Empire State bldg. If your planning on going anywhere else be prepare to walk. Donâ€™t be afraid to take the subway and ask for directions (Buy a 7-day sub pass itâ€™s worth it). The hotel is also in a safe area. Check out was ok, same as checking in. The front desk called us a car service to LGA a lot better than a cab but about $15 more. I would stay here again, but I would personally want something closer to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MvoeAlong
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure what it was. The hotel provided free ear plugs and a white noise machine. They had a letter on the counter when we arrived that apologized for the "garbage trucks" that they can't control. I think it was a construction site across the street but perhaps it was a garbage transfer station of some kind. All I know is that at midnight each night the horrible whirring, grinding, crashing and clunking noises one would associate with sounds that a garbage truck makes began and they continued without stop throughout the rest of the night, echoing throughout the entire neighborhood. And we were on a very high floor. I really think it was overnight construction work. But a letter in your room upon arrival (SURPRISE! YOU CAN'T SLEEP!) isn't the right answer. Full disclosure before booking (I booked direct via the web) and then let the market tell you what you can charge for that kind of problem. They also didn't provide clean towels. Oh, I read in the letter that they've got a green policy. I'm fine with that. But when the dirty wet washcloths are picked up from the floor and removed, they should be replaced without having to make a special request. (I really think this was done so that I wouldn't neglect to put a tip in the little housekeeping envelope as I did the first morning.) The youthful staff at the front desk could have been more helpful. I asked a few of questions but mostly felt like I was bothering them and didn't really get helpful advice anyway. The extended continental breakfast was serviceable if just average but with so little variety, I was over it by the fourth day. It would have been helpful if the restaurant would have been open, too. The price wasn't horrible and the location was really pretty good. But I'd go back to the real Wyndham on the next block for a little more dough rather than staying here again. It was a spacious room with a microwave and fridge, so that was a huge plus in NYC. But in general I'd rather feel really welcome and instead I felt a little scammed. Also, I understand that they need to clean carpets and chairs from time to time but leaving me a letter that it might happen in my room some time over the next few days isn't the best strategy for the guest. They should have also told me which day they were coming to my room and then notified me once they were finished. We picked stuff up off the floor repeatedly to prepare and then we returned before the carpet had dried the day they did it, something we only discovered when we walked on it in sock feet. There's management issues here, for certain, although besides lowering the price, I'm not sure what can really be done about neighborhood noise. Still, it's not my fault and I felt I was taken advantage of. My wife hardly slept at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Manhattan! Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: shiva901
Reviews.Content: I have been to New york before and stayed in the usual small rooms that Manhattan is abound with. Wingate in Midtown Manhattan though is in a league of its own! Location is excellent, Right behind Macy's. So if you wanna shop you are staying at the right place. TImes square is about a 15 mins walk. There are a few good eateries nearby, I would highly recommend the great bread factory which is just a 2 min walk. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are really well equipped, the staff very nice and friendly! Its just one fantastic Place! We are vegetarian and the breakfast held good options for us. A great way to start your day. if u are in Newyork look no further! Wingate is your best option (unles ofcourse you can afford the Waldorf astoria). The hotel room rates are simply fabulous! We were 5 of us and booked two double queen for two nights. (Traveling with parents). Seriously Stay Here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kid_n_play18
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading positive reviews from fellow travellers, I was not disappointed. The room was tidy, the bed was big enough for two people, there was a microwave and fridge and daily newspapers delivered to your room. What more would you want? Location would be the strongest point of the hotel, very close to Penn Station, Times Square is only a 10 min walk, you can take the subway to various locations such as Chinatown, Uptown Manhattan, Staten Ferry Island, Wall Street, Central Park..... If your coming from JFK airport, take the Air Train, then take the LIRR into Penn Station. You will probably be at the hotel within the next 30-45 mins easy. Exiting Penn Station to find your way to the hotel was extremely easy from the LIRR, follow the signs to 34th St and 7th Avenue, go up the escaltors to exit out on to the main street (34th St and 7th corner), go up one block along 7th avenue to 35th st, turn left (at Starbucks) and walk 100 yards. Breakfast, was ok, the times for having breakfast I felt could be a little more convenient, as Im not really a morning person. Overall selection of foods were ok, but I thought there could of been more variety especially for vegetarians and those who have food intolerances. Overall it was enough to get you through the day. Overall, great place to stay, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer22
Reviews.Content: THis was the second time I have visited this hotel, the first time with the family. I cant fault it, clean tidy rooms, pleasant helpful staff, wonderful location. If you are in New York then I cant recommend this hotel enough. Every request we made regarding the rooms and their location was delivered, too good to be true but it was. I suppose the best recommendation is I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Murrieta7
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly impressed with this hotel. Very clean, complimentary high speed internet , functional furnishings, comfortable bed and linens, fair price and a great location!! What more could you ask for? I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to the city. Thank you very much. Job well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Average New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d_soanes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not badly located as Times Square was within 10 minutes walk which is the reason for picking this hotel. Our room was comfortable although the view out the window is the side of building/factory. You would have to choose a fairly expensive hotel in order to overlook anything better in New York!! The breakfast room is small but has generous size donuts and pastries and the reception area is quite nice. Would recommend only because it meets the standards you would expect for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: newbieAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and i must say excellent value for money. I am a very fussy person when it comes to quality and cleanliness, this hotel met my standards. We arrived late at night and checked in very easy. Our room was a nice size and very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Even though you could hear the noise from outside especially when they were collecting the trash, the hotel provided ear plugs that you could use. I personally liked the noise coming from outside, it was a real new york feeling as New York is a busy city and noise is expected. The complimentary buffet breakfast was fantastic also. If you went early it wasn't busy and the food was great. Overall, this hotel is close walking distance to macy's, times square and all the shopping strips, we even walked to central park. If ever returning to New york we will be definetly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent"!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abs32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Wingate for 5 nights, and we cannot fault it in anyway, Staff were very helpful and pleasent, Rooms were cleaned every morning, breakfast is served between 6am-9pm throughout the week later of a weekend, and every morning there was sausage, scrambled egg, toast, muffins, bagels, pastries, yogurts, juices, tea, coffee and make your own waffles, there was never a lack of breakfast when we got there and we went some days as early as 6am and others as late as 8.30am and was always plenty of food, however the dining area does get busy the later you go. If you do miss breakfast there are loads of eateries to choose from, The hotel provides free wireless internet to all rooms, and also provides you with 2 computers both with internet access and printers which came in hand for us when we were cheking in online for our flight home and printing our boarding passes. Location of the hotel is great, closest subway to hotel is Penn station on the same block, Macy's is a 5 min walk away and dont forget to take your passport with you when you go and get an 11% discount card from the visitors centre in there for being an out of towner!, 10 mins to Times Square and Empire State. You can get tour buses around the island, we got a 3 day pass which included loads of stuff like a 2 hour boat tour along the Hudson river, entry into Empire State building and admission to hop on and off the buses whenever wherever you like and much more all for a price of $86 per person which is a great discount when you add up the cost of the attractions alone, you can but these from any of the tour guides you see in the yellow jackets and they can be found outside most of the tourist attractions and the bus stops.The Subway is a really quick way to get around and becomes very easy to use once you know how. We advise getting a "Metrocard" if you intend to use the sub a lot, you can top it up at any station and sub rides cost $2 for each ride whether your going 2 stops or 20 it will only cost u $2 a time. We got the subway to Central park which is somewhere i would highly recommend you go ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city if u just fancy a break from it all, and then we walked back home from there down 5th Avenue and called into most of the designer shops on the way back!!! we found out that for every 20 blocks it is 1 mile. There are different types of Restaurants everywhere, but we would definately advise going for a steak, there steaks are just amazing, One restaurant in particular is Nick and Stephs Steakhouse which can be found at 9 Penn Plaza near madison square gardens, and go for the Porterhouse steak for 2 at $44 per person and is more than enough for 2 hungry people and the side orders are huge!!! it is just fantastic, the staff are great and the restaurant itself it lovely. however if your feeling really tired and want to eat closer to hotel there is a restaurant attatched to the hotel called Luxe and you get a 10% discount when you show your room Keycard. I could go on forever its such a fantastic place and hotel was brilliant just wish i was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly be faulted”
Reviews.Author: gmorrs
Reviews.Content: This was our second choice of hotel after reading numerous reviews, however our first choice was not available on the dates we wanted. Firstly we were made very welcome on arrival, our room was clean, huge and a pleasant surprise to what friends who had already visited New York had experienced. We had free wired and wireless high speed internet at no cost, a safe in the room which was large enough to hold a laptop. I had taken earplugs with me as i am a light sleeper and i wanted to get some in the city that didnt, however the hotel was so quiet i didnt ever use them (room 1605) The breakfast was okay as it was free/included however it was quite basic and quite sparse at times, if you were not there early you lost out. Hot food was scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage in the shape of a burger (the thought of something shaped like a burger in the morning didnt appeal to me) and they served these 5 mornings in a row instead of day about with bacon at the start. You have to make your own toast and there are only 2 x 2 slice toasters, so if the breakfast room is busy expect a wait. My wife loves bagels and New Yorks are supposed to be the best but these certainly were not. Apart from that there is cereal, fancy cakes, tea, coffee, fruit juices and a waffle maker, but it's all help yourself and clear away your own dishes. Never used the gym or ate in the restaurant or drank at the bar. However the location is about as good as it gets, a stones throw (about 2 minutes) to Macy's, 10 mins to the Empire State Building, about the same to Times Square and 2 minutes to the subway (up and downtown) and Penn station. I would definately stay there again and recommend to others, just dont expect too much from the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingbutnotlost
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in early April at this hotel so the location was extremely convenient. The good points - The location is great and most major attractions are within walking distance and there is easy access to the subway station just outside the hotel. The hotel is close to plenty of restaurants. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The not so good - The price is justified by its location, but it is very high for the hotel quality. This hotel delivers below the average Sheraton hotel experience. The room decor is dated. Although the room did not have noticeable loose dirt, it clearly was not spotless as the carpets need to be shampooed. It gives the impression that it is a high traffic hotel with minimal upkeep. The room was too warm for me and I could not find a thermostat to regulate the temperature. The spa service was poor. I was initially really happy to learn that they had a sauna and steam room, however, neither were operating properly. I was only in the steam room for about 5 minutes when it shut off. I decided to try the sauna instead, but it also was not working. The sauna appeared to be turned on, but the temperature was at room temperature. I then had to go out to the front desk to have the steam room turned back on and also told him about the sauna. He said the steam room automatically shuts off if it gets too hot and that he would come in to check out the sauna, but he did not. So I returned to the steam room which shut off again awhile later. By that time, others ask him to turn the steam room back on and to come check out the sauna. When he did, the sauna problem turned out that it needed to be reset. Somewhat frustrated, I ended up leaving the spa after 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Aussiejigsnreels
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 5 nights in this hotel and have no complaints. It is in a great location, a very short walk to Time Square and only around the corner from Macy's, Victoria's Secret, Old Navy, Maddison Square Garden etc. Room had free wireless internet and the free breakfast is excellent with bacon and eggs, breads, bagels, pastries, cereals and my favourite, make your own waffles! Our room had two double beds and was your average size hotel room and was very clean. Best of all, for the middle of Manhattan, the room was so quiet. We had room 601 which was on the back of the hotel and had no outside noise at all. The windows are also double glazed for extra quiet. There is a subway station on the corner as well as Subway (food) across the street and a Starbucks at each end of the street. would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good facilities, good service, good value”
Reviews.Author: lkcLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for a good value trip to NYC. The rooms are modern, pleasant and very clean (beds very comfy!). The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel has a good service ethos. Examples - mobile phone reception isn't reliable throughout the building, so all US phone calls are free. If you make it to breakfast a bit late they haven't packed everything up and look at you disapprovingly as in some other places - no-one batted an eyelid at my late arrival. The hotel restaurant is low key but the meal I had there was delicious, and again, service was good. Only downside for some travellers might be that it doesn't have much soul - it's very much a business hotel. But given that it's got everything you would want at a good price, I imagine most tourists would be happy to stay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DaleJane
Reviews.Content: On a trip out east 4 of us stayed in 2 rooms for 2 nights. Rooms were clean and we had everything we needed. Rooms were more spacious than I thought they would be after reading reviews. They had some good work-out equipment. Staff was very helpful. We thought the breakfast was great! The Hotel was sold out but after a morning walk each day, we stopped in for breakfast between 7-7:30 and there were only a few other people there. I don't know what kind of breakfast some people expect with a $119 room rate. They had eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, cereal, bagels, pastries, juice, yogurt, etc. We thought it was super and didn't have to eat again until around 4 in the afternoon. We heard no noises at night and the free long distance was nice. We were using Amtrak to get from city to city so the location was perfect. We also took the short walk to Times Square, the Rockerfeller Plaza, Central Park, etc. several times. We had no complaints and will stay here again if ever in New York. My wife found several unbelievable bargains in the fabric stores on the block. Took the downtown tour on Grayline, took the Staten Island Ferry, and went to Top of the Rock. Lost my wallet in front of Penn Station while pulling brochures out of my back pocket. Should have listened to advice to always put it in a front pocket--what a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: vacationplannerMa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was roomy, comfortable and clean. We were able to walk to Times Square, Central park, 5th Avenue and many other sights. Location was really great but the ctreet itslef seemed a little seedy. It was my first trip to NYC and the hotel met my expectations and was very reasonably priced compared to others. Biggest negative-our room was right next tot he ice maker which was super loud and making ice all night and i sounded like someone was trying to get into our room. There is NO cell reception i the hotel, but they do allow FREE calls w/i the 50 states which was a plus. I would recommend this hotel. Not luxury but very comfortable and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: KRL724
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one week before Christmas and it could not have been any more pleased! The only problem we encountered was that the promised hot breakfast was not adequate for the number of people staying at the hotel. In fact, it was so sparse on the second morning we had to eat elsewhere. We got downstairs in plenty of time, they just hadn't planned well enough. Everything else, though, from the nice-sized rooms, to the free Internet access, could not have been any better. It's a short walk from Penn station and numerous other tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “The little things make me hate this place”
Reviews.Author: voldan
Reviews.Content: Its the little things about this place that cause me to give it such a bad review. I will start with the good though: The rooms are very large for new york (almost the size of regular rooms outside of new york). The room and bathroom were clean (although I wouldn't take a bath in the bathtub), the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The location is 10 minutes walk from time square which is pretty nice but the area itself is a little icky... The bad things were the little things: first the hotel decided to be "green" that meant they do not change the sheets or the towels during your stay. Sure they gave us towels when we asked for them but still its a little annoying. The air conditioner couldn't stay on the set temperature, it was either "heat" or "cool" but we could live with that by warming up the room and then sleeping with extra blankets. The really annoying thing was the baggage check. The check out time was 11AM (You can ask for 12AM and its still ok) but our flight was at 10PM. So naturally we figured we will leave out luggage at the hotel. They charged us 5$ per item assuming we take it by 6PM, they would have charged us an extra 10$ per item if we would want to leave it after 6PM. That is pure small mindedness greed. 15$ per item is outrageous. We ended up taking the luggage at 6PM and spending an extra hour in the airport to avoid this fee. Also we were in the 16th floor so everything was quite but when we spoke with guests who were staying at the 4th floor, we were told that the noise was unbearable, then again they supply a "white noise" machine...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: l65
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor stayed for 4 nights with my 3 teenage daughters during half term break. great central location, ideal for shopping and seeing the sights. excellent staff, helpful and knowledgable, their list of recomended restaurants was a real help. Room was very pleasant, clean, and surprising quiet, we were on the 14th floor, and I think lower floors could have been noisier. There was a fridge,microwave and safe in the room, and when I phoned about a problem with the safe, staff came straight away to solve it, excellent service !! charges for water already in the fridge are clearly marked on the bottles.. 2 computers available for guests with printers was a bonus. we had no problems with lifts during our stay, although other reviews have commented on this. Breakfast was good, there was a choice of 2 hot dishes, cereals, bagels,bread,yougurts and waffles. In our experience, food was replenished regularly and we always managed to get a table.It is self service and people tend to eat and go rather than linger. Just around the corner is the Bread Factory, ideal for a quick lunch or snack. Would recomend this hotel to others and would stay here again. We left luggage after checking out, it is stored in the lobby, but you are given a receipt for each piece which needs to be shown for collection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Location/Service in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: DunKev
Reviews.Content: Great Value/Location/service... Been visiting NYC about 3 times a year for the past 5 years and can say for the money, the Wingate by Wyndham Manhattan Midtown is the best value for quality I have found. The room was a nice size for NYC and the fridge and microwave appreciated. We took the train into Penn station for the first time rather than flying...2 block walk and your home. TIckets to MSG for a Knicks game was another 2 block walk. Time Square and the theatre district are a 15 minute walk...Macy's is a block away. Front counter staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet and the elevat0rs were quick (not too common in Midtown hotels) We will be back ...this is our new home in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: momo9978
Reviews.Content: Loved it. great location, room so clean. For a 3 star NY hotel, it actually had more than just a bed and a desk, it had a comfy chair too. The bathroom was clean, my friend and I were able to take a bath. The bed was comfy too. Definitely will want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Polite staff at a clean smartly styled well priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: JorMolchan
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a busines trip. The hotel staff were ALL very polite and friendly. From the front desk to people I passed in the hallway. The room was small (it is NYC) but stylish. The entire hotel was very clean and smartly styled. I had no elevator problems when departing at 8am on a Friday. The gym was compact and well equipped. I ate one meal on premises; it was first rate. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sarahstravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed as two couples for two nights in January 2009. Hotel was very easy to find and both rooms were great. Hotel was very clean and had good amenities, e.g., free wifi, fridge, microwave, etc. Beds were extremely comfortable and breakfast had a good choice, although was busy. The hotel was about a fifteen minute walk from Times Square and ten minutes from the Empire State Building. We arrived at about 11am in the morning, after sailing in(!) and had access to our rooms immediately. The only small negative was paying for the hotel to store bags on check-out. They charge $5 a bag but it is only for large suitcases. Also get your own taxi to the airport as hotel arranged transport was going to be double the price for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BazzaH
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids and I stayed here from New Years Eve for a week. I picked this hotel having read the reviews on this site and for its amenities offered. The room was clean but starting to look a little tired in places and was of a good size. We were on the 15th floor at the back and never had a problem with any noise. Having the fridge and microwave was great but they've started to charge $5 for the tiny bottles of water they leave in the fridge. Not a problem really though as you just nip to one of the numerous deli's nearby and get a big bottle for a lot less, its just the cheek of trying to charge $5 for a tiny bottle of water, they should just leave the fridge empty. They have also cut back on changing the sheets, towels and toiletries but this is all explained in a letter left in your room from the manager (economic climate, cost savings, etc,etc), again not really a problem but the prices haven't gone down either. The breakfast was okay, not much variety, but it was included in the price of the room. Macy's is just along the street (get the 11% discount card from guest services, it covers the tax they add on to everything) and the hotel is close to a lot of other New York stuff. We had a great time and this hotel was a great base. It's really more of a business traveller place but by New York standards is worth the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the wingate”
Reviews.Author: lippycow
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and 14 yr old daughter stayed here for Xmas. The hotel was comfortable. Rooms were a decent size. Cleaned daily. Reception were very helpful.Lifts were a nightmare during the morning as there were only two and the cleaning trolleys along with people checking in and out and others visiting the breakfast room were all trying to use them. Breakfast was fine if you got in early if you are a late riser you will be lucky to get a slice of toast!! Breakfast room very often full from 7.30 so we took food up to the room on some days. Position perfect. within walking distance of most places and underground stopped very close. Would recommend and would def stay here again, although bit pricey over Xmas as three days normal room rate increased due to time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, clean!”
Reviews.Author: Cherylovedd
Reviews.Content: Great! As first-time visitors to Manhattan, we found the staff to be extremely helpful with advice/recommendations. Our room was quite spacious and comfortable, much more so than I expected for Manhattan, based on what I've heard from friends who have stayed in other hotels. I have read reviews of other places that mention very cramped and unclean or smelly rooms - no worries about that here. Great location, very clean and quiet room, comfortable beds, and a great breakfast with eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, juice, coffee, fruit, muffins, etc., and plenty of everything! We were very, very pleased with our choice and would definitely stay again. You will be pleased!

Reviews.Title: “affordable and great staff”
Reviews.Author: letsgetawayTopak
Reviews.Content: wingate wyndham manhattan nyc 35th st dec 2008 we stayed there days before christmas, a family of 4 just needs a time away from home...and thats the perfect place. the staff was accomodating , free continental breakfast, good for family or just a business traveler. affordable, few blocks from empire state building ,near macy and times square is not that far either by cab about 5.00. anyways try to stay with your itenerary ,book a hotel according to what you want to do and what you want to see... i love going to new york .so much to do anytime of the year... and by the way if you' don't feel like going far for a meal or desserts theres the bread factory and starbucks at the corner of the street ....

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as i had hopped”
Reviews.Author: helen118
Reviews.Content: I have just return from 5 nites at this hotel. I did book cos of the reviews on ta. I have stayed in new york before and to be honest it was the best we have stayed in.
