But you do feel as if they are taking more and more money off you at any chance they have. From what i had read back in the early part of the year when i was surprised that the free water was now $5 each and that it cost $5 to have ur bags kepted for u. But they dont have any space so they are just left in the foya where anyone can get to them. We didnt recieves and of the free maps, information and popcorn we were lead to believe we would get. They were very helpful with advice on the best was to get us to jfk and booked us a car. Tho it was more costly than a cab the problem is that the street the hotel is on doesnt have many cabs going down it, my advice would be walk to 8th and there is a rank by the station. Free breakfast was fine on sunday but for the rest of the week we didnt bother. We couldnt get into the very small breakfast room. There are plenty of places to eat near by tho

Reviews.Title: “Too small”
Reviews.Author: xyzn
Reviews.Content: The location is not too bad for the price paid for NYC. 2 blocks from subway station, 2 blocks from Amtrak station. View is bad both at entrance and from room. The front desk is very helpful and cheerful in fact. The rooms is very small for 2 double bed. But they do try to squeeze a tea facilities area which sandwich between the front door and writing desk. The bed is decent, so as the bathroom. We did not spend too much time in the room since we're out sightseeing day and nite. Since our flight was only at 9 pm the next day, we tried for late check out, unfortunately the hotel was fully booked. So, after all the morning and afternoon walks all over NYC we had to sit at a very small sitting room awaiting our shuttle to the airport for 2 hours. We also had to do some of our packing (after more shopping during the day) at that open small space. Quite embarrassing though. BF was terrible. We have to do everything ourselves. And food is only replenished after sometime they are gone. The area is also very small to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Macy's - But Noisy from Street”
Reviews.Author: ukoberon
Reviews.Content: A great quality hotel - clean, tidy and fresh. Macys 1 block away and good location for MSG. Breakfast a great bonus although could be very very busy. Location isnt the best of areas in general but good as base. Only real complaint is the noise on some nights - I know the hotel cant help garbage trucks but tripple glazing and better soundproofing would help. we were on 4th floor and i had emailed and asked for a high room or a rear room - butin fairness it was thanksgiving week. I know you dont go to New York to sleep but even so I did need more than I could get! The staff are very friendly and fun. Overall the hotel is a great hotel - just a bit too noisy at street side and not in the nicest of streets.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: weloveny8
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Very friendly staff. Very clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: skyewalker16
Reviews.Content: Returned following a 4 night break over Thanksgiving. Hotel located very central 1/2 block from Macy's and walking distance to Times Sq, ESB, Grand Central Station. Subway located 1/2 block. Staff very efficient upon arrival and was quickly assigned a room on the 10th Floor. Reception very informative and offered free maps, tourist guides (and popcorn which was a nice touch). Also offered advise about the Thanksgiving Parade. Soon after entering the room the staff rang to see if the room was acceptable which it was. Room quite spacious but importantly clean with a comfortable bed and a heating system that worked and was quiet. There was some noise from outside but nothing that caused too much disturbance - After all it is the city that doesn't sleep. Read reviews about the breakfast and so I was not expecting much however I was pleasantly suprised. Plenty on offer and plenty of room to sit although we went down before 7.15hrs most days. Hotel able to hold luggage on last day and organised a car back to the airport. Generally found the staff, hotel and location to be excellent and would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wingate - 2nd visit and even better than the last”
Reviews.Author: Chilly25
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit and second review of the Wingate Inn. This is a wonderful hotel, the staff are absolutely fantastic (dramatic improvement on my visit last year), great location. Complimentary breakfast, comfortable rooms. 10/10 for everything! Will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ceannain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last weekend and would recommend it. We booked two rooms for five of us,three in one ,two in other. They both had two doubles. My room was on the 9th floor at the back and we didn't hear any street noise. The rooms were a good size ,comfortable beds and pillows and good showers. There was complimentary coffee,tea and water in the room and a free paper left outside your door on weekdays. It was serviced each day with fresh towels etc. Breakfast was better than we expected..scrambled eggs and sausage patties,bagels, english muffins and breads to toast,cereals,yogurts,fruit ,pastries and a waffle maker. Although some mornings were busy we always got a table and they constantly replenished the food. The lobby area is small but there is a nice mezzanine area with computers for your use and a nice sofa. It is half a block to Macys and the ESB is just past that. It is also one block to Madison Sq Gardens and Penn Station. We walked to the theatre (15 mins) ,Bryant Park,Times Sq etc. The only negative things were that there are not many restaurants/bars in the immediate area and we couldn't open the window in our room which made it a bit stuffy. Overall I would recommend it for good rooms,convenient breakfast and walking distance to a lot of things.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: graeber5
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and 2 kids ages 17 & 8. One of the nicest hotel staffs I've encountered in my trips to NY. It was reasonablly priced. It was a GREAT location - Macy's in the next block, couple blocks from Empire state bldg. Very Clean with free computer and internet use available. The Free Breakfast was really good. A slection of Pastries, bagels & cereals along with Eggs, bacon and make your own waffles. Although, if you want the best selection get there early. By 7am it was packed and by 8am most of the good stuff was gone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: agbPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night and were pleased with the cleanliness of the room. We arrived early and hoped to check in but our room was not ready. We were able to check our bags though. Did not find the staff to be overly friendly but they were ok. The heater in our room was VERY loud with a clicking sound that kept me up all night! I even wore ear plugs and they didn't help. I had expected to hear street noise but all I heard was the heater! Arrived at breakfast around 8 am and there was plenty of food available-very nice assortment. Overall, a nice hotel for the price,location is good if you want to shop at Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mollg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wingate on 35th street in Manhattan. Loved everything about this hotel. The staff were so helpfull, a great free breakfast each morning. The bed was the most comfortable one that I have ever slept in sheer bliss. The room was kept immaculate clean sheets each morning and lovely soft towels. The Wingate is in walking distance of all the Manhattan sights. Penn Station just a short stroll away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Big Noise”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 4-night stay based on TripAdvisor reviews. The location is nice...close to the theater district, convention center, Penn Station and shopping. Keep in mind that this property does not have the amenities one would expect from a typical Manhattan hotel: no bell staff or room service, and it was hard to tell if the restaurant was open or not. The included breakfast was decent for a free breakfast, but not great. On the other hand, the room was good sized for midtown, the hotel was very clean, and the bed was comfy. One word of warning: if you're not accustomed to street noise, request a room facing the back or on an upper floor. There is a great deal of construction going on on 35th Street, and every night between midnight and 3 am, a garbage truck shows up to haul away several dumpster-loads of construction debris. The hotel tries to help by providing earplugs and a white noise machine but I was awoken by this every night despite all efforts to block it out. I expected Manhattan to be noisy, but this was beyond the norm for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York”
Reviews.Author: Cleo11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 25th Anniversary. We couldn't have been more pleased. Our room was larger than I imagined New York hotels would be. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was a very convenient way to get our day started. We did not experience the food running low that other writers have mentioned. Neither were we bothered by street noise. We heard some, but we both figure this is a big noisy city. We were street-side on the 8th floor and got a good night's sleep for all three nights. We spent our four days here running all over the city and found the hotel's location to be extremely convenient. We were able to walk to the theatre district for several evening shows. The Empire State Building was also within easy walking distance. For all other parts of the city, we were only a half block away from the red or blue subway lines. We were both very pleased with the location at such a great price. We plan to stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Win-Win for Midtown”
Reviews.Author: kasey363
Reviews.Content: NYC is like a second home, and to find a decent, comfortable, very reasonable priced midtown location can be a rare find these days since hotel occupancy is at (and been) a high. Since there are so many hotels to choose - I recently found this one by a Wyndham Rewards promotion and was glad I did, as an affordable option for those frequent weekend trips. Location is decent - Short blocks to Times Square/theatre district, Madison Sqaure Garden/Penn Station/A C E, 1,2,3 Subway lines (two blocks) and really any central point to the city (Grand Central, Fifth Ave etc etc). From here walks in any direction and you have plenty of food and shopping choices - in the city you never have to walk that far or just get on the subway. Being in the garment district always makes for fun window shopping and bargins so consider that also if you have a clothes fetish. Hotel itself is smaller, clean, rooms are decent sized and newly furnished and finished. Bathrooms are new, clean and also decent sized. Flat sceeen TV, microwave, refer, coffee maker, room safe and free wireless in room. Dresser and standard size desk, and good sized closet also. For the reasonable room rates the room amenities and condition are excellent. Small fitness room and second floor open area with large TV, there is also a small business center also. There is a bar and restaurant on site which also provides the free breakfast in the AM. Hot choices of eggs, sausage, make-your-own waffles and plenty of breads, pastries, toast, cereals, yogurt, juice, coffee etc. More than the "average" cold continental offered at many of these mid-priced hotels now. Very suitable to get you going in the AM for a freebie. As for the concerns of noise - well I can tell you on the weekend that's not much of a problem; but certainly I can see it could be an issue on weekdays - for those lower rooms facing streetside. Obviously the hotel is aware of this since they provide a white noise machine and ear plugs in the room. An option is to ask for one of the rear rooms or at least a room on a higher floor (during the week when garbage collection is more prevelent since this street is a working-garment/office area). During a weekend it was not an issue at all (Sat/Sun). This is possibly the only concern you should have - depending on your stay. Overall - if you can get a new, clean, well amenitied location such as this for under $250.00 a night in this midtown location - it's a keeper, especially if you are training in and out from Penn Station/LIRR for a quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: arstenor1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a true wonder! It has a central location, near all the public transport and a block from great shopping (Macy's) The staff was warm and inviting anfd they got to know my name over the 4 days. The rooms were over-sized for NYC and very comfortable and well appointed. The hot breakfast was included and fresh. I have found my new home away from home in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJS2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 5 nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff were excellent. All were friendly and were more than happy to help with anything. The rooms were clean and tidy with a good bathroom. We were in a room overlooking the main street and yes there was 24 hour street noise, but staying in the centre of Manhattan we didn't expect anything else. The air con was a bit noisy,(but after days of living it up and with the help of ear plugs!) we slept soundly. We had a nice surprise when we discovered that our breakfast was complimentary. Breakfast gave a good choice of hot and cold foods. Although it did get a bit hectic in the breakfast room at times. Probably best to get there before peak times. The hotel was in an excellent location for exploring New York. Times Square 6 blocks away, Macy's one block and Madison Square Garden two. 34th St subway gave a good transport network for reaching other parts of the city. On the whole we would recommend this hotel and would have no qualms returning here.

Reviews.Title: “"Wingate Wyndham NYC" is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SCTinaB
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved everything about our stay here! One of the very nicest staffs ever! Everyone was so kind and helpful and they really seemed like they cared that we truly enjoy our time in New York. The rooms are so nice and clean and the beds are super-comfortable! The location is the best...we were so close to "Macy's", "Tic-Tock Diner" and even "Times Square". Felt very safe in this neighborhood. The breakfast was very good...lots of items to choose from and they had "4-Star" coffee! Would definitely recommend this hotel and we will certainly stay here if we return to New York for a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ANSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid Sept, we had a standard 2 bed room, which was shared by 3 people. The room was quite small especially when we were all there at the same time, but was perfectly fine in every other respect. It was clean with very comfortable beds, the bathroom was small but adequate (also very clean), and our room was right at the back so no street noise at night at all, apart from when they had a live singer in the bar downstairs one evening. Helpful front desk staff, breakfast wasn't great but not bad considering it's complimentary. We usually had breakfast down at Andrews? Coffee House just one block away from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a mid range budget.

Reviews.Title: “ok but”
Reviews.Author: Stebron
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and friendly staff but a few problems. The noise in this place is terrible at least in the front rooms as garbage trucks seem to go all night. They have a white noise generator in the room but it still doesn't drown out the noise. I stayed 5 days and never got clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “hate the noise”
Reviews.Author: amantedelanaturaleza
Reviews.Content: Nice room and amenities. Very warm staff. The noise was awful all day , but unbeareable at night with the garbage trucks working all night in front of the rooms located at the front. never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “best part of the trip”
Reviews.Author: Equusfan
Reviews.Content: my stay at this hotel was one of the best parts of my trip to NYC. The people that work there seemed to be the only friendly service personel we met. We were on the back side of the hotel and did not hear any noise from dump trucks, and my phone(at&t) picked up fine. You can walk to almost everything, but I don't suggest it. you will end up walking or standing in line the whole trip. we took a bus tour and got some great pictures. there was plenty of space to hold our clothes and the beds were fantastic. it was a nice haven to go back to after an exhausting day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, used soap”
Reviews.Author: kb213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate last weekend for the U.S. Open, and the convenience to Penn Station and the LIRR was unbeatable. The front desk was helpful and friendly, the rooms were bigger than many in NY, and the free breakfast was, well, free. There were, however, some problems. I realize that $250/night is fairly cheap for midtown NY standards, and I am all for ecologically friendly hotels, but . . . . we were given two used soaps in a new soap box. The other issues were that the shower curtain had lots of mildew on it, the bathroom was generally not clean, the air conditioner was extremely loud, and the walls were paper-thin. Moreover, as everyone else has noted, they often run out of breakfast food. Overall, a decent experience -- but the hotel could use some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular !!”
Reviews.Author: jim4966
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my room this very minute writing my review because I am so pleased with our experience here that I could not wait until I got home. I just came upstairs from eating my fantastic FREE continental breakfast. Eggs, sausage (bacon yesterday) bagels, toast, cereal, muffins, belgian waffles, fresh fruit, 4 kinds of juices, coffee and specialty teas. I am not even sure if I got everything. The room is exceptionally clean, and very roomy by NYC hotel standards. The front desk people have been more than kind and friendly. I personally booked this room based on these reviews only, so that is why I am writing mine so quickly. Everything is within walking distance and for the price I don't think there is a better deal out there. My husband and our 2 young daughters were here for a yankee game and the american girl doll store. It has just been a wonderful experience and I am so sad to leave tomorrow. I would highly recommend this hotel and for sure would stay here again. Oh and the fridge is great for leftovers with the microwave on top to reheat them. Free wireless internet also worked perfectly. If I could give this hotel 10 stars I would. Not one single complaint about anything. This is the best hotel in midtown and a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the city”
Reviews.Author: zeirdo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely perfect in it's own class. It's got great service, friendly staff, clean rooms (and both my wife and I are difficult to please) and the rooms look nice at that. The extra's, like the complementary bottled water and breakfast, are great add ons to help you start your day in the city. I was worried by the noise at first, but being up on the 15th floor at street side, this has not been a problem as of yet, and we have had great full nights of sleep. The long days and the great bed might have helped ;-). The bed by the way, is the kind you wish you could take home on a plane (bit big for carry on though...) Whether it's business or pleasure, this hotel is one I would definitely recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: WeeHiggy
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a very convenient position. We stayed for three nights in a spacious room with two double beds for myself, husband and daughter. Following flight cancellations, my husband and I were very grateful the hotel were able to accommodate us both for a further night (my daughter managed to get a flight home) and we were given a room with a king size bed and such a large room. Everything in this hotel was spotlessly clean and nothing was too much effort or a problem for all staff who were courteous, friendly and very helpful. I have to mention the breakfast, which was included in the price. This was much better than the usual coffee, tea and toast that is usually provided. There were cereals, croissants, breads for toasting, bacon or sausage patties, scrambled eggs and you could even make your own waffles and again nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were quite happy to replenish when things ran out. Definitely a hotel I would be happy to recommend and one I will be definitely be back to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for us!”
Reviews.Author: KDarville
Reviews.Content: I took my Teenage Nephew and Niece on vacation to NY City for 4 days primarily to see a Yankee game. I researched a lot of hotels around the same price as The Wyndham Manhattan, but none came close in comparison to the amenities that The Wyndham had to offer. The fridge, microwave, free wireless, free water and breakfast were huge benifits and made our visit so much more enjoyable. The room was a good size and exceptionally clean and the bathroom was very spacious, which was a pleasant suprise. The location was great, close to Macy's, train stations and a 10 minute walk from Time Square. The staff was great, and even held all our luggaqe for several hours after we checked out. I would highly recommend The Wyndham and will definately stay there again. K. Darville Nassau, Bahamas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheatreDad
Reviews.Content: My daughter was in NYC for a week-long theatre workshop around the corner so we booked the Wyndham for our stay ... the property was terrific and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Morning breakfast was simple but hot and delicious - better than lots of "included meals" you get at places like this. Note to cell phone addicts - your phone won't work in your room; I considered this a plus. The free wireless is a very nice touch; I actually managed to "work from home" without going out to a local cafe. I would definitely return to the Wyndham - it delivers on its promise of a clean, comfortable, and affordable hotel in Manhattan's midtown.

Reviews.Title: “good value good location”
Reviews.Author: shan10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is close to Times Square and Penn Station. The rooms are clean and well stocked with complimentary bottled water, coffee/tea. The continental hot breakfast was also a plus (although I'd avoid the eggs- they had a strange consistency- sort of like Styrofoam) But it was free so I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: aicirtapc5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wingate in NYC for 3 nights in May 2008. We ran into one problem while there but it was taken care of rigtht way. Since the city is so big it's hard to pick a perfect location for a hotel but the Wingate is in midtown and is very close to a lot of shopping. It is less than a block away from Macys. We arrived early in the morning and checked our bags with the front desk since our room wasn't ready. We got back to the hotel around 7pm to get our room. The clerk was very apologetic in telling us some bad news. The hotel had been overbooked and since we hadn't come back earlier the last room was given to someone else. The good news was that they booked us at the Sheraton in Times Square and were paying for it. They also reimbursed us for our taxi cab fare to the other hotel. Our first night in NYC was free! We checked back in to the Wingate the next morning and were happy to find a much larger room than the Sheraton. The bathroom and beds were very clean and the mini refrigerator in our room was a free added bonus. The internet service was also free. The people at the front desk were very helpful with any directions and advice we needed. The free breakfast was the usual foods but perfect and helped save with costs. The Wingate is a very small hotel with only 5 rooms to a floor. It's a great location and had very large rooms by NY standards. We couldn't complain about the over booking since it saved us an extra $250. You also get many extra bonuses for free that other hotels charge and arm and a leg for. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: ChiefHarry
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel close to Penn Station, resturant and show and this was a pleasant surprise. Wonderful staff and beautiful room. We will stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “PRAISE PARTY”
Reviews.Author: leevidaga
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from the hotel, in the 2nd day of a 5-day stay. Couldn't be more pleased with our accomodation. What has pleased us: Free WiFi internet connection in the room, satisfying all my family's connectivity needs simultaneously. (At another hotel, we would have been charged 3 separate charges for our 3 computers to be connected at the same time.) Free breakfast. Room charge inclusive of tax, which at a different hotel in New York could aggrandize your bill to the tune of another 15%. Two double beds in the a comfortably sized room. Powerful air conditioning. Friendly and professional staff committed to make your stay 100% satisfaction guaranteed. Met fellow guests and had a praise party in the elevator, two families echoing how pleased they were with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: HMSRH66
Reviews.Content: Best Staff we've ever met! We've traveled all over the U.S. but this was our first trip to NYC. The Wingate Inn Manhattan made the trip the enjoyable success it was. The room was great, the breakfast was wonderful, and the staff was the BEST. Thank you for a wonderful stay. We had plenty of room for a family of four and all the complimentary amenities were unbelievable. The only thing that might have made it absolutely perfect would have been an additional mirror over the desk instead of a picture. We had two teenage girls with us and sharing the bathroom was a little difficult with so much primping going on! :) :) Otherwise, everything was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZ_4
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for families. Room (2 double beds) was a good size and modern and clean. Fridge and Microwave are a plus. Good range of food at breakfast (although they did run out of some things at times). Good location although West-side area is a little dowdy. Handy to subway stations (hint walk only half a block west for the Blue Subway line)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent help !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: devilblue200
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate this past weekend and it was a great hotel for the price. The hotel is within walking distance of everything you want to see in Mid Town. The hotel is located on w35thst. but it is well lit up at night and felt safe coming to the hotel late at night. The front desk was very helpful with the subway system and everyone said hello every morning or even late at night. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, Ideal place”
Reviews.Author: Poipou
Reviews.Content: Absolutely ideal place to stay. The room was fine not small at all and very clean. We stayed in 405 which was at the back of the Hotel so you didn't hear any street noise (the rumble of the garbage trucks etc) in the mornings. Breakfast was good, not loads to chose from but enough to get you started for the day. Macy's just over the road, half hour stroll to 5th Avenue, Penn Station just a short stroll. If we go back to New York we will surely be staying here again it is so central for everything. Booked the Hotel and flight on Expedia excellent rates for those of us from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate a WINNER!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnotherCdntraveller
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Our first trip to NYC, and based on prior reviews on this hotel here, and the fact it fit our budget, we decided to book. This hotel is like the crown jewel of 35th Street. In amongst the street garbage and run-down warehouses, this hotel's exterior looks like gold. The front desk service...top notch! Friendly, always wanting to say "hello" and "Have a great day" as you walk in and out. Walking distance is minimal to ALL major sightseeing hotspots (especially the 35th street back entrance to Macys!)...we even walked from the UN building to the hotel in minimal time. Time Square is 7 blocks, but takes about 15 minutes to walk, and that's in NY crowds. Room bed might be one of the best I've ever slept on, and thankfully so as this helps deal with the garbage truck noise in the early morning (which really is not that bad). Free water and morning paper, and a sparkling clean bathroom. Then there's the free breakfast...full marks! And I usually dispise continental breakfasts. Great selection that changes daily. And they arranged our transportation back to JFK through car service...one cab ride was enough for us. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - super service”
Reviews.Author: Momsfav
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here on a 4 night stay in June 2008. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and courteous. Kudos to whomever does their hiring! We arrived exhausted after several flight delays - after 11 PM. The desk staff hooked us up with a welcome microwave popcorn and loads of print info and maps for our visit. We loved having the microwave and frig and daily bottles of water in the room. The daily breakfast provided included scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, bagels, English muffins, and simple pastries, several cereals, waffles, juices, coffee and teas - (buffet-style). It helped not having to buy breakfast every day. Located steps from Macy's - and a short New York walk from Times Square via 7th Avenue. Kinda cozy - just 6 rooms on each floor. Which we prefer over the massive "super hotels." Appreciated the free internet and printer access in the business center. We liked the fitness center downstairs- complete with flat screen TV. We used their available car service to return to LaGuaradia airport - $45 - and rode in comfort, stress-free in a Lincoln Town Car. Have already recommended it to friends. Hope to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erimentha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great with a good location. Nice and clean room. Breakfast was also verry good. One tip do not take the taxi to the aiprot from the hotel it self. Because then you will pay much more about 75 dollars. Just take the yellow cab its about 55 dollars. We would go back again. Greetz from The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: HorrisScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May. Very handy for Penn Station (5 minute walk) and various subway lines. Room bigger than average for New York, clean, comfortable with all necessary amenities. Breakfast basic but nice- gets busy after 8am so go early. Not the most desirable street but felt safe and great central location. Would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate--Friendly, Convenient, Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: FirstNYvisit
Reviews.Content: We flew Southwest and came in on the LIRR and walked the 1-1/2 blocks from Penn station to the hotel. We stayed here from Saturday thru Wednesday during the heat wave. Our air conditioner worked fine, just a little noisy. The maid gave us free bottles of water everyday and we had a small refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker. Everyone at the desk was friendly and helpful and they kept our luggage for us all day when we checked out so we could attend a theater matinee before taking the train back to Long Island. We walked to Macy's, Empire State Building, Times Square. Felt safe to come back at 10:30 PM on Sunday night from subway at Penn Station. We were close to multiple subway lines. Hotel was basic but new-looking and clean. We had an ADA room so the bathroom was large, they were generous with towels and the King bedroom was small but adequate with nice furnishings and flat-screen TV. They had wireless internet and a computer available in the lounge (cell phone wouldn't work in room). It was good to have free breakfast every morning --it saved time and money! We would definitely stay here again--much quieter than Times Square and so convenient. Ideal for anyone who wants something nice, quiet, and friendly but doesn't want to pay luxury prices.

Reviews.Title: “repeated A/C failures, poor response by management”
Reviews.Author: GerardN
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Wingate by Wyndham hotel on an unusually warm Sunday afternoon (around 96 degrees) to a attend a number of business meetings on the following couple of days. On arrival I was given a room where the air conditioner created loud vibrations, even when turned off. The hotel moved me to another room. In that room the A/C unit did not work at all and after insisting to be moved to yet another room, that A/C unit ceased to work today, Monday afternoon. While the engineers were trying all they could, the assistant hotel manager rang me later on purely to say that there was no issue with the A/C unit. It was clear that he just wanted to prevent me from making a claim against that hotel. I had no intention of doing so anyway. To top it off, overnight from Sunday to Monday, the warm water supply failed for the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: stacey1755
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, great little restaurant on site. Close to Times Square, Theatre Disrict, Central Park, The Empire State Building and the Subway. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: ironmanbob
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest the Wingate Inn on 35th street. It is the only hotel that I will frequent when traveling to New York City. The excellent staff, lead by Elvis Gonzalez and Jessie Tang, always ensure that my stay there is comfortable and pleasant. They treat their guests with respect and diligence. I've even gone so far as to recommend the hotel on my personal website. I commend them for running such a first-rate operation. As I stated, I recommend this hotel for all my friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaz3333
Reviews.Content: It was my first to New York, infact it was my first trip to the States and i loved every minute of it. I found the hotel on a website and it looked so clean and well decorated that i didnt have to look at any more. When we arrived we was made to feel so welcome. We went to our room 1503 and it was fantastic, everything immaculate. I could not believe our hotel was situated so close to all the near by attractions, everything was in walking distance. The restaurant situated in the hotel was wonderful, infact we ate there every night because the food and the service was out of this world. We was looked after and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. I did not want to leave, it felt like home. I would recommend anyone visiting New York to stay at Wingate by Wyndham and i know that when we visit again we will be asking for room 1503!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel - hated the noise which made it difficult to sleep peacefully!”
Reviews.Author: SF_Traveler80
Reviews.Content: The Wingate is a very nice property which was newly built, has very nice amenities, a beautiful lobby, wonderful hot breakfast included in your room rate, and super comfy beds.....unfortunately, it is a small hotel (only six rooms per floor) and it is very hard to get a quiet room. I had read other reviews about this hotel that mentioned the difficulty sleeping in any of the three rooms that face W. 35th Street, so I requested a back-facing room but none were available. So I ended up taking a front-facing room, and was awakened every hour between midnight and six a.m. by the garbage trucks picking up the trash down below. (If the staff tells you you won't hear the noise up on one of the high floors - which is what they told me - don't believe it! I heard every garbage collection all the way up on the 16th floor throughout the entire night.) The next day I requested a QUIET room in the back of the hotel, which the staff grudgingly let me have, after reminding me several times that Manhattan is a noisy city and implying that I was being a difficult guest. (Of course it is a noisy city, but I still expect to be able to sleep when I come here!) The "quiet" room they gave me was right next to the ice machine, which was silent all afternoon and evening, till about 12:30 a.m. when it started making ice and woke me out of a deep sleep. It basically sounded like someone had put a pair of stilettos in a dryer right next to my head and then turned the dryer on for 45 minutes. Even with ear plugs, it was impossible to get back to sleep with that racket going on. After my second night of poor sleep I asked if there were any rooms in the back of the hotel that were NOT next to an ice machine - there were, but not if you want a king bed. Apparently, all the king rooms are front-facing in this hotel and all the quiet back-facing rooms are doubles....except for the two king rooms in the back that happen to be "conveniently" located next to the ice machines. So keep that in mind if you plan on getting a king room here, because it is unlikely you will get a good night's rest. (Also, because this hotel has pretty reasonable rates for Manhattan, it is almost always completely booked, which makes it nearly impossible to get a different room if you are unhappy with what you have.) On the bright side, after you make it through yet another night of broken sleep, you are rewarded with a very nice hot breakfast - much more plentiful than most continental breakfasts at other hotels...this one had scrambled eggs and bacon, toast, cereal, fruit, pastries, bagels, and make-your-own Belgian waffles. The only other issue was that the phone in my room did not work properly, so I couldn't get any in-coming calls. As soon as they tried to fix it, I could no longer make any out-going calls either....and being in the back of the hotel, there was virtually no cell phone reception. Despite the lovely rooms - which are larger than most in this city - and the reasonable prices, it is unlikely I would ever stay here again....going five nights without getting much rest just isn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and so clean”
Reviews.Author: DingDongUk
Reviews.Content: To see a lot of the NY sights and easy access to the subway this is a great hotel to stay. Breakfast was complimentary and plenty of it with scrambled egg, bacon, sausage plus danishes, toast, jam and a waffle maker!. They have gym facilities and the staff are very friendly and willing to help with directions etc. The beds were made and the room cleaned on a daily basis and a good size with plenty of hangers, an ironing board and even an umbrella. The bathroom was spotless and the shower poweful. Altogether a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and New York”
Reviews.Author: posh'n'becks
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Wingate for 3 nights from the 24th to the 27th of April. It was our first time in New York and loved it. The Wingate was fantastic. The hotels were large and spacious and extremely comfortable. The beds were so, so nice and literally the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. The mattress was hard, which to me is the best kind of mattress. Location was perfect on 7th and 35th. Its a five minute walk from Madison Square Gardens and a 10 minute longer walk brings you to the Empire State Building. I can't even begin to describe how good the location was. Suffice it to say when we go back to New York we'll definitely be staying at the Wingate. We were up for breakfast at 6am and it was lovely. It was continental and was very nice. It was continental and also had bacon, sausages and eggs. It was quiet at the time we were in there as we wanted to get out and about and see things so I couldn't say what it was like later. Overall it was a fantastic holiday and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going to New York for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinOntario
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 4 different New York hotels over the past 4 years and this is by far the best. I read other peoples complaints, and if you are looking for a 5 star hotel, go there and pay 5 star prices. For value, location and price this is the best. The rooms are large for New York, and clean. They serve a very nice continental breakfast, but make sure you're there by 8:00 - 8:15 am. The location is great, just a few minutes walk from Times Square. Macy's and the Empire State Building is right around the corner. For someone who is going to New York for a vacation, is on a budget, doesn't know thier way around this is the best place to stay. I recommend it highly, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I no longer stay anywhere else in NY.”
Reviews.Author: mactravelBoston
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at the Wingate. I have stayed here several times over the past year and always had a great experience. I have stayed here with my Family for a weekend away and stayed here for work due to it's awesome location. I can get to anywhere I want, due to this hotel being one block from Penn Station, the subway, and walking distance to Times square and central park!!! The staff is always willing to help get you anywhere you want without getting lost!!! The free breakfast and fitness center help to finish my trip off. I will always stay at the Wingate because they have always taken such good care of me.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. A++++++”
Reviews.Author: dilshad99us
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wingate last week,11th-15th April and cannot rate it too highly,the front desk was courteous and efficient and nothing was too much trouble,the rooms were an excellent size and cleaned to a good standard every day.The location couldn't have been any better,Empire state,Macy's and Madison square round the corner,Times square 10 mins away. We didn't take advantage of the free breakfast and had ours at the Bread Factory Cafe round the corner(great value for money). We were on the 9th floor and couldn't hear much noise,the street was a bit scruffy but it was only 1 minute to 7th or 8th avenue. All in all first class.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Staff, Noisy Rooms for a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: The_Merk
Reviews.Content: It all started upon arrival: the woman at the front counter talking to a friend on the phone while ignoring my wife and me. After a few minutes, she got off the phone and, without once looking at us, snarled 'what name?' Charm and proper grammar, what a catch! We answered her question, and I asked her if our request (placed at booking) for a quiet room could be accommodated. It was currently the middle of the check-in period. She informed us that most of the rooms were not yet cleaned (!) and that we could leave our bags with her, and return in an hour (!) to see if one of the quiet rooms would be available. Much to our surprise, once she heard that we had seven bags to leave (and she would have seven claim tags to fill out), a room suddenly became available. I again asked if this was a 'quiet' room. She told me that 'yes, this is a quiet room. If you have one of the other rooms, you'll be hearing the garbage trucks all night." We thanked her and went up to the room, which, to our surprise, was rather large (especially for NYC). It was nicely furnished, as well. Later that evening, after returning to our room (around 11:45 PM) we were surprised to hear the beginning of the garbage truck procession that would serenade us for quite some time into the early morning. I called the front desk to ask about getting the room switched, only to be told (by another surly front desk person) 'we don't have any other rooms, and we don't control the garbage trucks'. No kidding, I thought the sanitation department reported directly to you!!!! Bottom line, pluses: good room size and amenities, rather clean, decent price. negatives: staff, street NOISE, neighborhood a bit 'iffy' and deserted after dark, inconvenient and expensive parking garage (next block over).

Reviews.Title: “No too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: primpops
Reviews.Content: Our family of four have just spent 5 nights here. Very easy to find, great location with everything in walking distance. We had a very quiet room which I had asked for. The room was a little on the small side for two adults and two teenagers but it was fine for the time we spent in there. the maids were very friendly and efficient and the rooms was spotless. Beds were a little small but we were exhausted so didn't move much when in them!! Most of the staff were helpful apart from one guy on reception who was very cool. No warmth in the welcome when we arrived after a long flight with a 7 hour delay! Breakfast can be a bit of a farce. First couple of days were good - there are only about 14 small tables in the dining room which is very cramped. 14 floors of rooms with 6 rooms per floor!! Breakfast finishes strictly at 9.00am weekdays and if you come down at 9 there is nothing left. The waiters want you out by 9.10am. They are helpful but it cannot be very easy working in that dining room. the final day there was a large college group in so when we went down for breakfast at 8.30 there was nothing left! No supply to demand - when its gone its gone. This probably spoilt our stay as we had been down very early the rest of the time and out quickly so the last day we wanted a bit of a rest -8.30am - not that late surely. All in all we loved NY - but I think when we return for the marathon in November we will try and find an apartment. Andrews Cafe 7th Ave/ 35th street - excellent by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttravel79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wingate for 5 nights and can recommend. Don't go here if you want pampered luxury, you won't get it, but you wouldn't expect to for the price in its location. i'd compare the rooms to that of a Holiday Inn style (not overly modern, but clean and definitely not shabby). The rooms were well presented and clean. Considering this was Manhatten, the rooms were a very nice size. Coffee makers in the room, not kettles (a pod/sachet machine). Free internet access and complimentary breakfasts (mainly pastries, bagels, cereal and a couple of hot items, like eggs). There was also a waffle maker to make your own, note the breakfast room can get very busy!! Only half a block form the entrance to Macys and has a Starbucks at either end of the block (35th & 7th and 35th & 8th). Great Midtown location walkable to Empire State, Times Sq and nearest subway entrance at 35th & 8th! great for NYC, you won't be in your room much anyway!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just a few niggles”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller1957
Reviews.Content: LIke all the reviews say, the hotel is well located in Midtown, (although the immediate surroundings are a bit downmarket), it was ideal for us on our family vacation. The complimentary breakfast sounded great, but choice was a bit limited. The breakfast room tended to get crowded and there were shortages of plates, silverware, cups, and even food every day. Its not the hotel's fault, but cellphone service was really bad - non existent on the fifth floor. Our room door lock needed to be reset twice as the keys kept being rejected, and one one occasion we were left waiting at the room and had to ask at reception twice to get it fixed. Despite asking at reception the room safe was not unlocked. We had a room at the front of the hotel and it was really noisy all night as garbage was collected / delivery trucks for Macys went by. Others in our party had a room at the back and it was really quiet. So - ask for a room at the back, and keep on at the staff if you need something fixing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Business Travellers in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: I booked myself and my colleague into the Wingate after comparison shopping on Trip Advisor. We were both very happy that I'd done my research! The Wingate prides itself on being set up for business travellers and this was definitely the case. Free high speed internet in the rooms, comfortable desks/chairs/beds and a heck of a lot more space than I'm used to having in New York City where you can pay $400/night for a tiny box. We paid $315 including tax and there was literally nothing more I could have asked for from this hotel or my room. In fact I've already booked another stay next month when I return to our New York office. It was a little unfortunate that two high school dance teams were staying at the hotel (teenage girls - you figure it out) but it was a weekend so I guess we can't really complain. Reception was terrific though - put both me and my colleague onto floors where the girls weren't. Again, what more could one ask? Except mute buttons on 100 teenage girls, but I don't think the staff could have helped much on that front. The breakfast, which is included in the room price, isn't fabulous but it's acceptable and should suit most tastes. The eggs were runny and tasteless, but we were there towards the end of the morning so it might just have been bad luck. But really it's unfair of me to complain - it was free and did the job. My only suggestion to the property is to ditch the loud pulsating music in the lobby. While it can't be heard from the rooms (so it's not a problem per se) it's quite annoying when you're waiting to meet someone or for your car to arrive. It doesn't seem to fit the brand of the hotel, so I found it a little cognitively dissonant. But that's a minor comment that should be taken in the context of what was a really comfortable and enjoyable stay. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “geat hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mozziej
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the wingate for four nights mid feb. it is a lovely hotel, tucked away just off 7th ave on 35th, opposite Macys. it is a small hotel but the rooms are very spacious and comfortable. the breakfast was a great start to the day. it is an ideal location for sightseeing, shopping etc as you are only a short walk from times square and there is a subway at the end of the street. normal rates are pricey but we got a good deal through one of the websites connected with tripadvisor. would highly recommend this hotel. mary, ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLulu1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate Inn from 9th-14th February and what a great location this hotel is in! We booked following the great reviews given on this website. It is very close to the subway stations for getting around up and downtown and just a short walk to the Empire State Building and Times Square â€“ plus for any shoppers out there (like me!) Macyâ€™s is just at the top of the street! The Hotel is newly built and everything has a clean and new feel. The rooms are big and the beds comfy. There is a fridge, microwave and coffee machine in the room, plus there is free bottled water given daily. They even provide a free â€˜Time Outâ€™ Magazine so you can find out whatâ€™s happening in the city. This hotel also provides breakfast and it is a good variety â€“ eggs, bacon, bagels, toast, waffled, cereal and fruit â€“ really helped set you up for a good day of sightseeing. This was our second visit to New York and we stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn on our last visit which was great but I think the Wingate tops it, if only for the breakfast option!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: elinor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wingate for seven nights in January while on business in New York city. I selected it from one of several suggested by my travel agent because of its location - minutes from Macy's, Madison Square Garden and several subway lines. It is on a quiet part of 35th street between 7th and 8th Avenues. From my arrival to departure, I could not have wished for a better hotel or location. The staff were courteous and friendly. On arrival I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on an upper floor. My room was spacious, clean and well-furnished with easy chair, desk and chair ( with WiFi access), HDTV and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was light, clean and well-appointed. The room was well serviced every day. Coffee, tea and bottled water were provided free of charge daily. Breakfast was included - fresh fruit, scrambled egg, bacon and waffles as well as the usual fare. All in all, a great room and hotel to return to after a busy day or night. I'd return and with my family.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sturmey
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York. I had researched various hotels prior to settling on this one (mainly as a result of the reviews on trip-advisor). The hotel is very centrally located and is just a couple of minutes from Maceys, 5 minutes from the Empire State building and 10 minutes from Times Square. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and the room itself very pleasant. The breakfast was what you would expect in the U.S.A. The dining room is quire small but we always managed to get seated (perhaps because the hotel wasn't overly busy). In all, I will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New York”
Reviews.Author: Hibby
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York arriving late on Christmas Eve from UK. Prior to arrival Elvis Gonzalez, front desk manager had been most helpful providing us with excellent advice. We liked the hotel and were given a high floor room on the 17th floor so noise was never a problem. The location was excellent for walking and for the subway though getting a taxi was a problem on this one way street. Excellent proximity to Maceys, Emprire State Building and Madison Square Garden. The front desk were really helpful with our tourist questions that they must have heard a thousand times and we really appreciated that. Breakfast was a disappointment as on Christmas Day and the two days after, there were no tables to sit at, they run out of eggs, bread, cutlery etc and they just could not cope with the number of people in the restuarant. I think that this hotel is designed more for the business person than the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shinexxon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently, and I have to say out of all of the hotels I have stayed at in NYC I have to say it made my top 5. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast bar was great! We picked the hotel because of it's close proximity to Madison Square Garden. We felt very comfortable walking back to the hotel after our concert was over. It was in a great shopping area also with Macy's right down the block. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The only complaint I have is that since the hotel is small, they don't have a taxi stand outside. When we left, the front desk was a little busy and declined to call a taxi for us. They told us to walk up the street and hail one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much booked again for 2008”
Reviews.Author: mooandmae
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after extensive reseach on the internet, most hotels were hugely overpriced for the time we wanted to travel, I admit this was not the cheapest but it certainly wasn't anywhere near the most expensive. This was the frirst time we've been to New York and all we heard from friends were horror stories about small hotel rooms and bad service etc. As this hotel in new the rooms were a reasonable size and the fixtures and fittings are all new and quite modern. The staff were really friendly and helpful but not at all overbearing which is one of my pet hates, i can't stand all the fake 'have a nice day', I like to be left alone to get on with my holiday. The location is great, far enough away from Times Square and the crowds but near enough for a short walk and it is literally seconds away from Macys. The hotel is not on the prettiest street but we felt safe, The street is not filled with shops and yes you can hear the binmen and some noise in the morning, but hey you are in New York the city that never sleeps. Make sure you take advantage of the breakfast it was great, I would highly recommend the make your own waffles!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but hey this is New York!”
Reviews.Author: Big_Daddy_Si
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wingate for 2 night in November 2007. My room cost Â£220 per night, which is expensive for a 3 star hotel, but after hours of research I gave up on finding anything cheaper or better (I was getting quotes of Â£400+ per night for 4 stars!) I understand this is New York, but compared to the Â£110 I was paying at the 5 star Mandarin Oriental in Miami where I had been staying a just a few days earlier I felt this to be rather inflated. But hey market forces and all that. The Wingate ended up a good choice in the end â€“ it was on the same street as Macyâ€™s and it was just around the corner from the Port Authority Building where I go to catch the bus to make my yearly pilgrimage to Woodbury Common. Despite being close to Macyâ€™s the Wingate is slightly off the beat and track and the hotel itself was not easy to get a taxi from. When I went back to JFK I booked a car through the hotel to collect me instead. This was my only other grumble about the hotel as I sat in reception for over 30mins waiting when the car was outside but the staff on the front desk failed to tell meâ€¦ good job I left plenty of time getting to the airport through the infamous NYC traffic!!!!! My hotel room was clean and had its own heater / ac unit. Each room has its own fridge and microwave, plus coffee making facilities. There was also an inclusive continental breakfast downstairs behind reception. View was a typical NYC view, of the next high-rise hotel block! Useful Business centre downstairs, with access to free internet and a printer, which meant I could go to the airport armed with my boarding pass and pre-booked seat. Finally I would just like to share my â€˜wisdomâ€™ on NYC â€“ this was the fourth time in 4 years that I have been to the big apple. The flights get cheaper and cheaper, the Â£ and Euro get stronger, but this influx of â€˜bargain huntersâ€™ is meaning that Midtown Hotels just get dearer and dearer as demand for accommodation gets stronger and stronger. Donâ€™t let this put you off though! Plenty of bargains still to be had though!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: Terinator
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot in Europe and the US but this was our first trip to NYC. Travelers included me, my wife, my 20-year-old daughter and her boyfriend. We were there a few days before and after Thanksgiving (Nov) 2007, partly scheduled at this time to see the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Hard to compare with other NYC hotels as, again, this was our first stay in the city. The room was comfortable, particularly the beds, and everything worked fine. The staff was friendly and helpful with regards to hotel features, etc., though know very little about the surrounding area. The hotel location is fantastic. While there is a terrible view (typical NYC narrow street "canyon" with trash on the sidewalk each morning) it was only a block from the west entrance to Macy's and about two blocks to the Empire State Building. Walking distance to virtually everything, and only took us about 15 mins to get to Times Square and about 30 mins up to the south side of Central Park. I really only have two complaints about the hotel, and one of them they can't really do much about, which has to be the noise. No wonder NY is the "city that never sleeps" as it's next to impossible with constant police sirens. Literally ALL NIGHT LONG. I doubt there was a 10 min stretch without it. The solution? BUY EARPLUGS at one of the numerous pharmacies. Also, it MIGHT be slightly better on the other side of the hotel. We were facing 35th Street so all the noise from Broadway traveled down the canyon. If you were facing the inside of the block (north, for example) then it might be a LITTLE better. The only complaint they can really do something about is the breakfast. Granted, we were there at a busy time and the breakfast area was not planned to hold everyone at the hotel, or presumably even a fraction of that. Only about 20 people can be seated at once, with usually only one of the two waffle makers working, which could mean a 20-minute wait. They usually have eggs and sausage providing you're one of the first 30 people through in the morning, otherwise they run out. Ditto for the coffee. There are also a few donuts, pastries, and yogurt. What they have is plain but decent -- they just don't have enough of it on a busy morning. Fortunately, being NYC, there are a couple $5 breakfast places within a one-minute walk (on Broadway.) I wouldn't mind staying there again, though since NYC is so big, we'd probably look at staying somewhere up near Central Park as we didn't get much opportunity to explore that area. For midtown, though, we were happy with this hotel. Also, be advised that booking early saves money... my daughter booked about six months out and paid less than half of what we paid booking three months out! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly ....the best!”
Reviews.Author: Marleneann
Reviews.Content: After very long flights from Australia my husband and I had a chilly weather welcome to New York. The Wingate Inn Midtown was an excellent choice for our stay in Manhattan. Only twelve months old this accommodation included complimentary breakfasts. Boy... did I enjoy those make-yourself waffles! Internet and use of gym were free. It is only half a block from Macy's Department Store so the position was perfect. Very friendly staff greeted us at the desk. We had two full days to explore the city and take in the beautiful sights of the Christmas lights and decorations. We booked at a "special price" and couldn't have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandHappy
Reviews.Content: We recerntly stayed at the Wingate for 7 nights, this hotel was great. The rooms and beds are huge and the staff are so friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was in a great location, we were able to walk to Macys, Times Square, Empire State and Madison Square Garden. Breakfast was great, we didnt eat it every day but the waffles were a treat. A useful tip for anyone going to visit the Empire State - buy the express ticket on line before you get there, it lets you walk to the top of each queue, when we went there was a waiting time of 1 hour to get to the top, we by passed this and got up in 5 minutes. You are also able to walk to the top of all the queues coming back down. This is well worth it especially if you dont have much time in New York. All in all the Wingate is a brilliant hotel and the location is even better. Would stay here again and have recommended it to people who I know are going to New York next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wiganwarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4-7 Dec 07. The hotel in an excellent location midtown just a block from Macy's and easy access to most attractions and subway. The rooms were clean, well maintained, good size and beds comfortable. There were plenty towels in the bathroom and there was a wall mounted plasma TV, fridge, microwave and coffee machine in the room. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was great. The hotel lobby was very small but hey, so what. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: flaburthe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Thxgiving weekend. Overall a very good choice for NYC. Centrally located with the advantage of being a little outside the Time Square madness, still close enough to walk there. Rooms are very clean, well appointed and good size for NY. All amenities. Staff was very nice, breakfast a little crowded, but overall good selection. Make sure if you do need 2 Double Beds to call and re-confirm that this is what they have reserved for you. We had reserved a double Queen and when we got there none was available so they ended up giving us 2 king rooms instead (but that was because the hotel was not 100% booked)... Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexandria4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice and clean. The bathroom was big and had a full bath. The staff was helpful and friendly. We stayed on the 15th floor facing the street. Even though we were high up we could still hear the garbage man at around 6:00am. But besides being woken up everything else was good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, but beware of overbookings!”
Reviews.Author: leeseattle
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay here. The room was spacious (by NYC standards), clean and very quiet. The staff (front desk and housekeeping) was beyond friendly (smiles, eye contact and seemingly genuine interest in being helpful). It was nice to have the complimentary breakfast, but the food was nothing to write home about. But, hey, it was free and when you're in New York, free anything is great! We were on the backside of the hotel and it was very quiet. This place appears to have really good soundproofing between the rooms and floors as we never heard a peep from anyone, even though the hotel was full. We did, however, have virtually no cell phone signal in our room and had to head down to the lounge on the second floor to make any phone calls. No big deal, especially because local phone calls were free. One recommendation, though. Try to arrive earlier in the day as the hotel was oversold on the night we arrived. Perhaps this was a fluke, but it'd be a pain to travel all day and find yourself without a hotel room.. We got the last room. I felt bad for the 3 parties that were just arriving as we were getting into the elevator. Also, there aren't a lot of restaurants near the hotel serving dinner after 10:00 pm. We had quite a long walk trying to find a place open for business the night we arrived. However, the location is great as far as convenience to the subway, etc. Nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: ScotandHelen
Reviews.Content: Problems from the start. If you sleep facing the main street, and happen to be on a lower floor, you will hear the pounding of a recycling truck right across the hotel. It lasts until 4am, and is loud! We were moved to a different floor, only to find the ice machine dispensed ice all night long on its own! And it wasn't quiet either! The location is ok, staff not bad, but not good. 2/10

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality for Value”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNestMichigan
Reviews.Content: Checked in Friday, stayed 3 nights. Room 602 Room was extremely clean and comfortable. This hotel is tucked away on 35th street just 1/2 block off 7th avenue. We walked here from Penn Station with our luggage no problem. The total experience was a great one. Mind you this was at a rate of $399.00 per night, which I think is outrageous but other hotels of this type were at $459 and above. We took subway throughout all of Manhattan easily from this location. We walked till very late at night and felt very safe. The hotel is fairly new, no restaurant on site so no room service, this was not a problem as there are many restaurants near by. The rate included a breakfast every morning, eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, fruit, yogurt, bagels, cereals, juice, etc. Rooms had flat screen TV, on wall, also came with microwave and mini fridge, coffee maker, no mini bar stocked with overpriced items. Staff all friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. By the way if looking for inexpensive place to eat, try the department store Macy's just around the corner. In the lower level they have a "Marketplace", salads, sandwiches, hot foods, pasta, etc all at a good price. Wish we would have found this sooner. All too often we ended up paying high prices for rude service and bad meals at other restaurants in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet, good breakfast and central”
Reviews.Author: NZweekenderLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value. Huge Kingsize beds, rooms and bathrooms. Lovely bed linen, very clean with a complementary breakfast of pretty much everything you could imagine including nice waffles! It is around the corner from Macy's and a few streets from the subway to go up to Central Park or down to Soho. Our room was at the back of the building with a dull view of another building, but it was perfectly quiet, which is good considering the constant traffic and siren noise in NYC. We had stayed at the Beekman Tower hotel which was a dive compared to this place. I recommend it. Plus the staff were great, sorted us out taxi's and loads of other stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price! Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kcthecat
Reviews.Content: What a find in the heart of Manhattan! Right around the corner from Macy's and Madison Square Garden this hotel has a lot to offer. Nice size rooms even for our family of four (2 adults and 2 teenagers). Not the greatest views, but for the price the rooms are clean and comfortable and the hotel is in close proximity to public transportation. Don't let the side street scare you at night-it's just half a block from the main arteries and we felt safe walking back at night from Times Square and the theatre district. There are two computers that are very accesible. One on the second floor overlooking the lobby and the one on the lower level is less busy. Also, the breakfast is very good with a nice selection to choose from and great coffee! The staff is especially helpful and very accomodateing. Will definitely stay here again. I hope I didn't ruin our great find by telling too many people!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate Midtown Manhattan from Aug 25 to Sept 3, 2007, and it was an enjoyable experience. The hotel is new, the rooms are fresh with very comfortable beds, and a flat screen TV. The complimentary hot breakfast is excellent, with make-your-own waffles, bacon and sausages. (It could use a little variety though; we stayed there 9 nights, and the breakfast was the same every day). The location is perfect, it is in the heart of the fashion district, with Macys and so many other shops and attractions (Borders, Madison Square Garden) a two-minute walk away. Subway stations for the main lines are at the corner of the street, or a short block away, including Lines 1,2,3, A, C, E, Penn Station and other main lines. Hence, the hotel is so easily accessible by subway, train, and bus. The staff, every man and woman, were courteous, friendly and helpful. Any request we made was promptly and cheerfully attended to, even if made in the wee hours of the morning. You appreciate that kind of service, especially after an exhausting day, or after 20 hours of air travel. (As an aside, I should mention that we arrived at JFK airport at 7:45pm, and made the mistake of calling for an AIRLINK NYC shuttle at 8:30pm. Not only was the driver late by an hour, he went around the 10 terminals of JFK for almost 2 hours until he filled his van. Then he did not know the location of the hotel. So, we arrived at the hotel 4.5 hours AFTER we called AIRLINK! We strongly advise travelers against using this shuttle service. Use SuperShuttle instead, which is reliable and efficient). There were, of course, a few problems (no hotel is perfect). When we arrived at the hotel at 1am, all rooms had been taken, so we were placed in room 305, which is a room designed for handicapped guests. Hence, there was no bathtub, and no closet for clothes (just an open rack). More importantly â€“ and this is critical to business travelers â€“ there was no mobile phone signal at all in that room, perhaps because the room was at the back of the hotel, with tall buildings around, and it was a low floor. This may be true for all No. 5 rooms in every floor, so travelers should specifically request not to be placed in that room. We complained, and were transferred 2 days later to room 1204, and that room was perfect. It was larger than our previous room, and because it was fronting the street, I could easily get a mobile phone signal in the room. There was a tub and a closet. And the TV was facing the bed, while in the previous room, it was crammed on top of a drawer to the left of the bed, making it uncomfortable to watch. Travellers should ask for high floor rooms facing the street to get the best deal. On the whole, we would highly recommend the hotel to business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “This a fantastic deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Kodachromette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sept 22-26 2007. Read all the reviews and checked out their website. We were thrilled that they were all accurate! The Wingate on 35th in NYC is an amazing deal in a city that charges hundreds of dollars for a worn out looking room. The hotel is EXACTLY like it's pictures and claims: big room, up to date furnishings, free bottle water, refrigerator, microwave, breakfasts, a business center, a real closet and helpful staff. The only downside is the location on 35th street...not the prettiest street in the city. However, it's conviently located so you can easily walk to many of the sights, loads of restaurants, etc. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value!”
Reviews.Author: hvtrust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night (Saturday) at the Wingate. It is located in the Garmet District and just a couple blocks from Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station (Amtrak or buses). It's a great location if you want to do a lot of shopping! We arrived before check-in and our room was not ready, but they held our luggage. The front desk was very courteous, friendly, helpful, and referred to us by name. The room was clean and we had a room on one of the top floors (which we prefer to decrease street noise). I would recommend requesting a room NOT on an ice machine floor. The ice machine is located in the hallway next to a room (I'm sure it made it a very noisy stay for someone in that room). The free continental breakfast was a nice treat! They had hard boiled eggs, waffles, juice, coffee, bagels, fruit, yogurt...good enough to get you going in the morning. This hotel offers FREE wireless internet as well. There is a microwave and refrigerator in the rooms. We enjoyed our brief stay at the Wingate and we would recommend to others...and it was inexpensive compared to other hotels in the Manhattan area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JwalKilkenny_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 1st week of September 2007and have to say this hotel is very good. Location wise it is very central to Midtown Manhattan, and Times square and Central Park are within easy walking distance. the Empire State building is less than 10 minutes away and Macys for shopping is 5 minutes walk so over all this is an excellent location.This hotel has very high hygene standards and room service is excellent. The staff at this hotel could not be more helpful and are of excellent mannners and courtesy and have to say its a pleasure to speak to them. So overall i would recomend this hotel to anyone looking for a good Hotel and good location and excellent cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “A good small hotel in the centre of midtown”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short as the hotel already has a lot of reviews on this site. The good: - Hotel is very clean - We had rooms at the back of the hotel (the twin rooms are at the back, the king at the front) and it was very quiet. Virtually no street noise which is unheard of in the area - Location is excellent (times square 10 mins, Macys 3 mins, Empire State 10 mins) - Rooms are a decent size - Staff are eager to help and friendly - Free breakfast and free water in the room each day. The not so good: - Facilities are little lacking, for example no bar, restaurant or room for getting changed once you have given up your roon on the last day - The road the hotel is on isnt that great at night... however it is literally a 40 seccond quick walk from seventh av so we didnt find this a problem. Overall we had a great stay and if you want to stay in the midtwon area this hotel is an excellent choice for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Paulywaully
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said,clean,big rooms,even our room with 2 doubles and a wheelchair to store,the staff were brilliant,they would ask you about your day where you had been all very pleasant with good personalities,ask if everything was ok no problems all of them from the cleaners to the desk staff,everybody would help you anyway they could.As for a former comment about being dark and scary,I was never scared walking down the street with my wife from wherever we had been in New York,I actually felt safer walking the streets at night in New York than in my home city of Manchester Uk.I would recommend this hotel to anybody,in fact I did today to a workmate who fancies visiting New York. If any of the staff read this reviews THANK YOU ALL,for making my stay,which was my 3rd visit so good. Didn't take any photos of the room as the photos on the hotel website are a true picture of the rooms and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate keep the word”
Reviews.Author: skyline73
Reviews.Content: I've booked my room in large advance for my 10 days vacation in NY; I've been in this wonderful town several times before and I know perfectly that in Manhattan you can fall in trap also in expensive hotels. This time I've carefully read all the valuable reviews posted on tripadvisor before any decision and thanks to them I've taken an excellent choice. Even if I'm Italian I write this review in English in order to make it available for a larger number of users; in this way I hope that my review will be useful as those I've read. The hotel is extremely clean and everything seems brand new: this is particularly remarkable in a city where often the hotels shows the signs of their oldness. My room was spacious and very comfortable (especially the wonderful bed) and I've appreciated the complimentary water (pay attention: only the water with the apposite label is free; the bottles in the fridge are with a fee of 5 dollars as you can read in the cap). Oddly there's nothing else in the fridge with the exception of the water: I've found this point a little bit strange actually.
