Unfortunately I've to confirm the main fault that other users have recorded: air conditioning is extremely noisy and I was compelled to turn it off; this can be a significant discomfort in the hottest periods of the year. I hope that the staff is able to read this repeated signal in the reviews in order to do something to solve this problem. The complimentary breakfast is really a bonus: generous, assorted and pretty good; appreciable also the 24hour gym (even if I've never taken advantage of it). Noteworthy the internet connection, not limited to high speed connection in room: there is a computer in the business center, with free connection for all the guests lacking of a laptop. Regarding the location I've to deny who spoke about a dangerous zone: the 35th street is not the most luxury part of the town and is quite dark and dull especially during night hours, but there's nothing dangerous here. Honestly I prefer all the midtown blocks placed beetween Central Park and Times Square, but only for their glisten appearence, not for safety reasons. Totally useless add other candid pictures, since all those you can find now are really trusty. Finally, considering the price I' ve paid for my king bedroom, 160 dollars per night, I can consider this hotel very good...it could be excellent with some slight improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! great staff and lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: newbietravellers
Reviews.Content: We went to New York in June on our honeymoon and trawled through hotel and hotel on this site to find one which didnt have bad feedback which I have to say was a hard task... this was the only one with no bad feedback so we booked it. We were not disappointed. On arrival the room was not ready and there was a little mix up with rooms but it was ok, sorted and they were professional and put it right. The room was lovely (we had a penthouse suite top floor with balcony) I can highly recomend one of these rooms, the bed was huge, the aircon whilst noisy in the day time was suprisingly quiet at night. The location is perfect for the first time New York visit as its round the corner from Macy's and the Empire State. All in all a fantastic hotel, no restaurant but hey its New York! and if you want to stay in the hotel they have a fantastic array of take out menus to choose from who will deliver to the hotel for you and the staff are happy for you to bring food in at any time. A great hotel and a trip of our lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Ok by Day don't gou out at Night”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueUniques
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC about every 4-6 weeks and have stayed in almost all the hotels. We have many of our business wholesalers there in the city. We like staying near the Javitz and near Macys as it is walkable to the many things we do and less crowded than midtown near Times Square. We heard the great reviews on Travel Advisor and decided to give this a whirl. Be aware that there is no bell hop at this location and if you have a lot of baggage there will be no one to help. To catch a cab you also have no bell hop and must go down the block to Macys to pick one up, not so good when hauling all your luggage. Otherwise you can do what we did have them call a car for you to meet you at the front door. Rooms are small and clean. Breakfast is nice but very very crowded they did not allow enough space.This hotel is located in the garmet district and after 6pm the place becomes dark and full of very interesting characters. Most of which you could do without gathered in clusters. There is not a security guard on duty at this hotel either. No one outside monitoring anything. There is very very little light while walking back to the hotel after dark and all the business that surrounds the area is closed with their garage door down and clusters of men that are gathered around. It is only about a block and half from Macys but after dark it is a long long walk! DId not feel safe at all there. If you are traveling alone or with another woman I do not recommend staying there if you plan on going out after dark. Before dark is fine. For the money The Radisson is in a much better area with lots of light and lots of security and it includes a bell hop and easy access to cabs .

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: hlouiseSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! I am picky, especially about cleanliness. Rooms were spotless and large, wifi was great, and AC worked well. Breakfast was more than I expected as well. I will be staying here the next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels81
Reviews.Content: I came accross this hotel while visiting New York with a friend last April. We were not entirely happy with the hotel we booked and another tourist we were chatting spoke very highly of her stay at the Wingate. We called into the hotel to enquire and they told us about a special rate that had just been advertised, $120 for the room, very reasonable for NY! The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and could not do enough to assist us. The room was beautifully decorated if a bit small. A twin room consisted of two extremely comfortable double beds, good sized bathroom, tea/coffee making facilities and a microwave. Internet access was free and very fast which does not seem to be common in NY hotels. I would highly reccommend this hotel, it is close to all the action and shopping, I would definitely try to stay again on my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendyjc
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at the wingate, one for my parents and one for my husband, 18 year old son and myself. Both were comfortable well looked after and none of us had any complaints. The staff were always on hand and always keen to help. The position in the Garment district is great, most things being within walking disatance. The view and the street that the hotel is on are not particularly inspiring but then that is not what you are going to New York for I would assume. Breakfast was brilliant and the 'cook your own waffles' was fun. Complaints from previous reviewers re the scarabbled eggs were interesting. The hotel has wither reviewd its egg supplier, changed its cooking method or some people are just to darn fussy because all 5 of my party could not see a problem. The fact that the room price included breakfast was good enough for us!!. I would recommend thsi hotel to friends and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal In Town”
Reviews.Author: fostercityrez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two days (8/19 - 8/21) and after scouting out the other hotels we were going to book with, we are convinced we got the best deal. We had wanted to stay at three other hotels and actually canceled on one after reading the reviews for this hotel. We were not disappointed. Our room seems brand new. The fixtures, toilet, sink, tub, countertop were all premium quality and spotless (no mildew even under scrutiny). The bed was extrremely comfy. The sheets / bedspread were spotless and premium in feel. We also had a fridge and microwave! Wow. We really appreciated the fact that so many things were included in the price at no extra charge: internet access, business center access, bottled water, luggage hold (because we arrived too early), and free hot breakfast (unheard of!). Finally, the staff was extremely helpful. They gave us great suggestions for food and directions. Our only complaint is that the air-conditioning fan is fairly loud. But man, does it do the job. It cools down the room in five minutes flat. There is no question we'd come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate- it's a winner!”
Reviews.Author: headwatersgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate for 4 nights with our teenage children. The Wingate is located smack-dab in the garment district, which means that it is fairly quiet at night when you need to sleep. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained. The rooms are a good size for Manhattan, and ours included two double beds, a large desk, microwave, small refrigerator, flat-screen television, and a generously sized bathroom. A deluxe continental breakfast was included each morning in a lovely room at the back of the hotel. The location is perfect- 35 th street just west of 6 th avenue. I was kind of shocked at how nice the staff were- some of the people in the stores in New York tend to be rude. This hotel is extremely good value for the money. We are so pleased with our stay, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: bear79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate of Wyndham for 5 nights and would stay there again if we return to NYC. It is very centrally located and close to Penn station which is very handy when catching the 7.15am train to Niagara Falls. The room was very comfy and spacious with an awsome shower. The only downside is that most rooms have an air vent which is quite noisy. Staff were very helpful and were able to recommend a restaurant close to the hotel when we arrived quite late in the evening. The breakfast spread was quite impressive with the waffle makers in high demand. Get in early or you'll miss out. We paid $US290 per night (taxes included) which I thought was a bargain for this standard of hotel in August.

Reviews.Title: “I'd gladly go back”
Reviews.Author: Kerplode
Reviews.Content: I will start this off by stating that we weren't originally supposed to stay here, but I'm so glad that the company I booked with overbooked the other hotel, because our stay was fabulous! I'd heard the horror stories about small rooms in New York...that isn't so here. Our room with one king bedwas a wonderful size, the bed was super comfy, the entire hotel is smoke free, and breakfast, while not superb, was hot, substantial, and free. I would have ranked everything perfectly if not for one inattentive guest service agent - the one who checked us in. Everyone else was amazingly helpful and nice. Also, the brochure of the hotel in the room said that the hotel had a hot tub, but it didn't. It did, however, have a nice computer with printer and free DSL so that you can print your boarding passes or what have you. This hotel is only a few blocks away from Penn Station NY, which makes it really easy to get to from airports via public transportation. (We were able to get there from Newark for $15 on the AirTrain.) Also, there is a small subway outlet on the corner which will easily transport you to Times Square or Rockefeller Center if you don't want to make the walk. (It is very easy to walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center...it just takes some time.) It is also really close to great shopping (it is in the garment district afterall), restaurants - try Scotty's for some yummy grub, and the Empire State Building. My favorite eatery - though off-topic - was Serendipity 3 for Frrrozen Hot Chocolate, accessible via the subway. Overall, this hotel was such a pleasant surprise. I'd definitely stay there again. And, for the price and the rating as a 2-3 star hotel, it was luxury and excellent. It is definitely underranked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pentree68
Reviews.Content: done my internet research last winter for our first trip to New York this August/2007. Came across this hotel in Manhattan. Clean rooms, friendly staff and great morning free serve yourself breakfast (waffles, sausage, eggs, cereal, fruit, juices etc.) hotel also has great fitness room and computer room for guests use. easy walk from here to Empire State Building, Macy's (right up the street), Madison Square Gardens, Times Square etc. Great eating places also in the area. Subway locations within 1-2 blocks to take you anyplace you need to go in New York. We had a great time in New York and the Wingate was a great place to stay. By booking early I got a great rate of $189 a night (plus taxes). This was a great price for this part of town. It was worth it. The only down side to my stay is that the bed pillows are not comfortable. They tend to be big and hard than most pillows. Besides that it was great. The front desk was super helpful answering any questions you have about getting around New York. For $45 the hotel also provided a SUV vehicle service back to the airport. Didn't have to worry about finding a taxi etc. One final thought. If you're going to New York for the first time, buy a good map of New York City and its subway lines. Once you are familiar with the subway system you can travel all over New York, Bronx, Brooklyn etc. for $7 a day. Its the way to go. Also buy a cheap compass so you can tell which direction you're walking. It was a great trip and Wingate is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: reddyme04
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Check in is at 3, and we were allowed to check in early to a freshly cleaned room. The room is up to date. We never used them, but there is a gym and a business center in the hotel as well. The air conditioner worked extremely well on the scorching weekend we stayed there. It seemed loud, but didnt prevent me or my bf from sleeping. There was complimentary water, and a fridge and microwave in our room, and you are a few blocks from Times Sq, Madison Sq Garden, Penn Station, and Manhattan mall, and the subway stop is at the corner of the street. The problems I had were very small. First, the view was awful, then the bed and pillows were very firm and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive "complimentary" Water”
Reviews.Author: mijade
Reviews.Content: All in all it was a OK stay. As other guests have noted it is quite noisy on the street with construction? going on in the middle of the night. We were on the 14th floor but still woke many times on our first night (a Fri.). The next night was better. The room was clean enough and the bed comfortable but the pillows were horrible. We had stiff necks from using them, the second night they stayed on the floor. The continental breakfast was adequate and a bonus. It did disturb me though on both mornings of our stay that people walked around barefoot in the breakfast room. I like the saying "No shirts No shoes No service. But I guess I'm one of the few because this seems to be allowed at the Wingate. My biggest gripe about the hotel is the "free water" they provide their guests. I knew they provided complimentary water so when I opened the fridge I saw two bottles of water and assumed these were free of charge. We both saw no sticker or tag to indicate we would be charged $5.00 dollars per bottle. I complained to management but the charge stayed on my bill. I feel we were taken. With all the hotels in NYC we will stay elsewhere on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Wingate”
Reviews.Author: baljaffray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wingate for 4 nights at the beginning of July. We had selected this hotel after reading so many positive reviews on Tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to those comments. The room ,while not huge, was fine for 2 adults and 2 teenagers and it was clean and equipped with everything you could need for a short stay. The complimentary breakfast was the best we have experienced in any hotel we have stayed in, in the US. We found the staff to be helpful on the few occasions we had to ask anything. Our only concern before we arrived was that we had read one review which said that the area was a bit dark and scary at night time, we did not find this at all. We found the location ideal- in less than 5 minutes you can walk to Times Square,in 2 minutes you can walk to bus pick up points for the hop on/off bus tours, Macy's is just around the corner(very handy for dropping parcels back to the room) and we found the nearby Starbucks and Bread and Cake factory great for snacks and meals during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place but we were also a victim of movie fraud.”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: Price is good for NYC, $179. Includes real breakfast, not "continental" crap, only about 100 yards from Penn Station, clean new rooms, Short walk to Times Square, great friendly service (except for the charge for movie when we were not even in the room which is to be "investigated" by manager and credited to card. This will not happen in your lifetime so raise loud hell at checkout in front of as many people as possible). Until this scam we had a very nice stay. Cheating people out of $10.00 is pretty petty and hardly worth the trouble. If you are going to steal make it big time.

Reviews.Title: “great,clean,CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: buzmar86
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night 6 day stay in New York City. What a great place to stay. The free breakfast is worth it's weight in gold. I'm talking sausage, bacon, eggs, waffle maker, juices, fruits. The staff is there to help with your every need. The rooms were spacious and VERY CLEAN. The hotel is on 36th street. 5 blocks from Broadway. The subway is 1 block away. You are very close to the center of everything. This was one of the best value hotels we found that stated non-smoking. Would recommend and stay there in a hearbeat again.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate is a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: SJG5
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I recently stayed at the Wingate for 8 nights. We were very happy with our stay, and we found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Unlike a few of the other reviewers, we thought the staff was very friendly, from the people at the front desk to the sweet little housekeeper polishing the wood in the elevator who greeted us with a smile and told us to enjoy the day.The room was cozy for the three of us (2 double beds), but we understand that hotel space in NYC is at a premium, so we were prepared. The decor was updated and appealing, the granite bathroom counter was generously sized for all our stuff, the room and bathroom were clean, and the beds were comfortable. The shower was strong, the water was hot, the towels were thick and fluffy. Even the toilet was an upscale brand--Toto,which is one of the best on the market. The microwave and refrigerator came in quite handy. I will admit that the bathroom fan is loud, but it works well, and the room air conditioner is noisy also (many hotel A/Cs are like that). We discovered a curious thing about it --we realized it wasn't just a coincidence that the A/C came on whenever we entered the room after a long day of sightseeing. It shuts off during the day as an energy saving measure, and as soon as a warm body comes back in the room, the A/C starts up again. The manager explained that there was an infrared sensor that was responsible for this curiosity. This wasn't a problem (cudos to the hotel for conservation), and we were fascinated by it. The breakfast was good, though I personally didn't care for the scrambled eggs--on the dry side. There were lots of other things to choose from--sausage, bacon, pastries, bagels, waffles, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. The location is convenient, and the hotel is easily accessible to several different subway lines (1-3 blocks away, depending on the line you want.) It is 1 block from Macy's, and is close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Now for the downside. The hotel isn't perfect, and if you are looking for a 4 Star hotel, this isn't it. It is on a dingy side street, and the view from our room was looking at a warehouse- type building. The housekeeping was hit and miss, but this could have been due to our particular housekeeper. On a few occasions, we didn't get fresh mugs and glasses; toiletries weren't replaced during our stay even though the manager said they should have been; and one day, the housekeeper forgot to leave us any towels. We found ourselves calling down for stuff like this more than we should have had to. However, the management and front desk always cheerfully and apologetically took care of the requests, so I can't complain too much. All in all, I rated it a 5, mainly because of the good value compared to other NYC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate's a Scam!”
Reviews.Author: atvforfun
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I checked out we had a mysterious movie charged to our room. We never purchased a pay-per-view movie while we were there. The desk clerk stated he couldn't do anything for us and then provided a specific "movie" Memo from the Manager stating that movie charges could only be adjusted by the Manager. And of course, the Manager wasn't available when we checked out. Seemed like a scam to us. I will never stay in this chain of hotels again and do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JEFSUSHAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my wife and child and was very pleased with the hotel. Good free breakfast buffet and hotel was very clean. The location at first looked bad but was ok . The room we had was 1002 and no street noise which was a big plus in NYC. Close to everything would stay again here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: rip2632
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay at the Wingate was a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious (by Manhattan standards), modern, clean, and comfortable. Our only suggestion for improvement would be that all 4 of the pillows are thick and fluffy--so bring your own if you require something thin for comfort. The 35th St. location in the fashion district isn't very scenic but is quiet at night, and subway stops are within a block so transit is not a problem. The complimentary breakfast was fabulous, making our stay an overall great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wingate's a Winner”
Reviews.Author: rytesideup
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Wingate. The room was wonderfully cozy. As we only needed room to unwind, this fits the bill. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the flat screen tv was a nice touch, and the room itself was impeccably maintained. Absolutely no mold or crud in the restroom,(no tub either but that's o.k.), the furnishings were in excellent repair, and the amenities were as described. It is by no means a luxury hotel, but it is a great place to stay if cleanliness and comfort are the most important things on your list. They also offer a discount on parking. Make sure you get the sticker from the front desk. The attendant was kind enough to let us know were to park, but he didn't go the extra half a centimeter to tell us about the discount. Otherwise a great trip. Within walking distance to timesquare, empire state building, madison square garden, and more. We often returned to our room at 1 or 2 in the morning. We stayed in room 205. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: JordanWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New York for the first time and LOVED everything about it! We pretty much went there knowing nothing about New York except for the obvious sightseeing attractions. We booked our hotel off of the reviews (it had the most positive experiences than the others.) We arrived on a Monday to our hotel - my first impression walking into the lobby was - how beautiful and modern it looked. We arrived 2hrs. before check-in, so I thought for sure they would say our room wasn't ready and we'd be stuck with our luggage, but to my surprise it was ready. We had a king size bed (very comfortable) and the room was very spacious. From the various reviews we read for several hotels - the complaints were usually: very tiny room, air conditioner didn't work, dirty, bugs etc. Our experience was far from it. Our room was VERY clean, air conditioner always worked (in fact - sometimes we had to turn it down a bit), never dirty and didn't see one bug - plus the room was the same size as any other hotel we've stayed in. The breakfast was good and the hotel staff was very helpful with our questions. We called for extra pillows and had someone knocking on our door 10 min. later with them. We saw the exercise room (very nice) and used the business office to access our email and printed out some ferry schedules. Not thinking we would need to access a computer - it was helpful to be able to use their's any time you needed. The hotel is in a nice location to some things however I think I was expecting to reach Times Square within 15 min. as previously read, but it seemed a little longer than that (25 min) - maybe I was a bit anxious and it just seemed to take longer. I really have no complaints about the hotel except that I wish it was a few blocks closer to Times Square and all the action there, but for the quality of this hotel - I would be happy to stay there again. Who couldn't use the exercise - walking is good for you, right?

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Vacation in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Cherifiz_from_Plano
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC in Mid-June and stayed at the Wingate for 7 nights. What a WONDERFUL HOTEL! We couldn't have asked for an overall better experience. The Hotel is in a fabulous location within a few minutes walk of subway stations, Penn train station (we daytripped into Philadelphia), and Times Square. There are also many great restaurants within about 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel and Starbucks on each end of the block. The Hotel complimentary breakfast is wonderful (we all stuffed ourselves each morning because we didn't know when we would be able to take time from our sight-seeing to have lunch). We were able to easily walk to Rockefeller Center in about 15 - 20 minutes and the subway ride to Central Park (and 5th Avenue shopping) could not have been easier. Our room was very clean and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the flat-screen TV was great. The hotel has a very boutiquey feel to it (despite its being a chain) that we found charming. We had absolutely no complaints and will definitely be back to the Wingate the next time we visit New York City.
